EmailTemplate.name: Certification
EmailTemplate.Body:
A new access certification report has been assigned to you: $workItemName.
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this access certification report.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying work item owners of new certifications.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property (also the name property) of the certification WorkItem.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object for the certification.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the certification.

Argument.name: ownerName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that owns the certification.

EmailTemplate.Subject: New access certification: $workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Bulk Reassignment
EmailTemplate.Body:
$!requesterName has assigned $numNewIdentities users to you for access certification. These have been added to $certificationName.
Description: $!description
Comments from $!requesterName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!comments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this access certification report.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a user when they have been reassigned identities from an existing certification.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification containing the items to reassign.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the items to reassign.

Argument.name: owner
Argument.Description: The Identity object receiving the reassignment request.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: Comments from the reassigner.

Argument.name: description
Argument.Description: Description of the reassignment.

Argument.name: numNewIdentities
Argument.Description: Number of identities reassigned, passed as a string.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the reassignment.

EmailTemplate.Subject: New certification reassignment request: $certificationName

EmailTemplate.name: Delegation
EmailTemplate.Body:
$!requesterName has delegated the following work item to you: $!workItemName.
Comments from $!requesterName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!comments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this request.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying work item owners of new delegations.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem created for this delegation.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property (also the name property) of the delegation WorkItem.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: Comments from the delegator.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the delegated item.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the delegation.

EmailTemplate.Subject: New delegation request: $!workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Delegation Revocation
EmailTemplate.Body: $requesterName has revoked the following work item from you: $workItemName. This work item will no longer appear in your queue.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying work item owners that their delegation work item has been revoked.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property of the delegation WorkItem.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the delegated item.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the delegation.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Work item revoked: $workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Delegation Finished
EmailTemplate.Body: $delegateeName has finished the delegated item '$workItemName'. Please review the items.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying the original owner that the delegated item has been completed.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property of the delegation WorkItem.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the delegated item.

Argument.name: delegateeName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that finished the delegation.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Delegation Completed by $delegateeName

EmailTemplate.name: Remediation Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
$requesterName has revoked one or more entitlements from you.
Comments from $requesterName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!comments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#if ($remediationDetails.nonModifyAccountRequests && $remediationDetails.getNonModifyAccountRequests().size() > 0)
Account Requests: ----------------- #foreach ($acctReq in $remediationDetails.nonModifyAccountRequests) Application: $acctReq.applicationName Operation: $acctReq.operation Account ID: $acctReq.nativeIdentity
#end #end #if ($remediationDetails.modifyAccountRequests && $remediationDetails.getModifyAccountRequests().size() > 0)
Modification Requests: ---------------------- #foreach ($acctReq in $remediationDetails.modifyAccountRequests) Application: $acctReq.applicationName #if ($acctReq.nativeIdentity) ## Role modification requests in IIQ won't have a nativeIdentity Account ID: $acctReq.nativeIdentity #end
#foreach ($attrReq in $acctReq.attributeRequests) Operation: $attrReq.operation Attribute: $attrReq.name Value(s): $attrReq.value
#end #foreach ($permReq in $acctReq.permissionRequests) Operation: $permReq.operation Permission: $permReq.target Right(s): $permReq.rightsList
#end
#end #end
EmailTemplate.Description:
Email Template for notifying users that an item has been remediated. Notice that this is setup to CC the user's manager (see CC attribute above).
Arguments --------- item: The CertificationItem being remediated. remediationDetails: The ProvisioningPlan with the entitlements being removed. (Convenience accessor for item.action.remediationDetails) identity: The Identity that is having their item remediated. comments: Comments from the remediator about the remediation. requester: The Identity that remediated the item. requesterName: Full name of the Identity that remediated the item. (Convenience accessor for requestor.fullName)

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being remediated.

Argument.name: remediationDetails
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningPlan with the entitlements being removed (Convenience accessor for item.action.remediationDetails).

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity that owns the item being remediated.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: Comments from the remediator about the reason for remediation.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name (usually full name) of the identity that requested the remediation.

Argument.name: requester
Argument.Description: The Identity object of the requester.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Access is being revoked by $requesterName

EmailTemplate.name: Remediation Work Item
EmailTemplate.Body:
$!requesterName has assigned a new remediation work item to you: $!workItemName.
Comments from $!requesterName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!comments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this request.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying work item owners of new remediation requests.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The name (also the description) of the remediation work item.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object representing the remediation.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the remediation.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: The Identity object that is the owner of the work item.

EmailTemplate.Subject: New remediation request: $!workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Certification Sign Off Approval
EmailTemplate.Body:
$certification.name was signed by $certifier.displayableName and requires your approval.
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this request.
EmailTemplate.Description:
Email Template for notifying users when a certification is signed and sent to them for approval.
This supports the following parameters: - certification: The sailpoint.object.Certification object that was signed. - certifier: The sailpoint.object.Identity that signed the certification. - approver: The sailpoint.object.Identity that needs to approve the certification. This is the recipient of this email.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the delegated item.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object for the certification approval.

Argument.name: certifier
Argument.Description: The Identity object for the user that finished the certification.

Argument.name: approver
Argument.Description: The Identity object that is the owner of the work item.

EmailTemplate.Subject: $certification.name requires approval

EmailTemplate.name: Certification Reminder
EmailTemplate.Body:
$recipient.displayableName,
The certification "$certification.name" is still open and needs to be completed.#if ($certification.expiration) This certification must be finished by $spTools.formatDate($certification.expiration,3,1).#{end} Please login to IdentityIQ to complete your work.
Sincerely, $sender.displayableName
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for reminding a certification owner that they have a certification waiting for them to complete. This is an "instant" email sent on demand from the certification dashboard components. See EmailBean and Emailer.compileOpenCertEmail for context.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object we are reminding someone about.

Argument.name: recipient
Argument.Description: The Identity object of the user being reminded.

Argument.name: sender
Argument.Description: The Identity object of the user doing the reminding.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Reminder: Certification needs your attention

EmailTemplate.name: Work Item Reminder
EmailTemplate.Body:
This is your $ordinalNumReminders reminder that the work item $workItemName #if($requester)requested by $requester.displayableName, and #{end}created on $spTools.formatDate($created,3,1), #if($expiration)#if($expiration.getTime() > $nowDate.getTime())is due on $spTools.formatDate($expiration,3,1).#{else}was due on $spTools.formatDate($expiration,3,1).#{end}#{else}was due on $spTools.formatDate($oldDueDate,3,1).#{end}
#if ($newDueDate > $expiration) The due date has been extended to $spTools.formatDate($newDueDate,3,1).
#end #if ($remindersRemaining > 0) This work item will escalate after $remindersRemaining more reminder(s).
#end Please login to IdentityIQ and view your work item inbox to resolve this at your earliest convenience.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for reminding work item owners that their work items are overdue. NOTE: In addition to the declared arguments, all entries from the work item attributes map are also available by name in the template.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The name of the WorkItem.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification.

Argument.name: ownerName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that owns the work item.

Argument.name: requester
Argument.Description: The identity object that represents the creator of the work item.

Argument.name: ordinalNumReminders
Argument.Description: The number of this reminder, starting from 1. Passed as a String.

Argument.name: remindersRemaining
Argument.Description: The number of reminders remaining after this one. Passed as a String.

Argument.name: oldDueDate
Argument.Description: The former due date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: newDueDate
Argument.Description: The new due date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: nowDate
Argument.Description: The current date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: created
Argument.Description: The date the work item was created, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: expiration
Argument.Description: The optional date the work item completely expires, passed as a java.util.Date.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Work Item Reminder

EmailTemplate.name: Work Item Escalation
EmailTemplate.Body:
The work item "$workItemName" escalated. It previously belonged to $oldOwner and was due on $spTools.formatDate($oldDueDate,3,1).
It has now been assigned to you#if ($newDueDate), and its due date has been extended to $spTools.formatDate($newDueDate,3,1)#end.
Please login to IdentityIQ and view your work item inbox to resolve this at your earliest convenience.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for alerting new work item owners when an item has escalated into their queue

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The name of the WorkItem.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification.

Argument.name: ownerName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that owns the work item.

Argument.name: requester
Argument.Description: The identity object that represents the creator of the work item.

Argument.name: ordinalNumReminders
Argument.Description: The number of this reminder, starting from 1. Passed as a String.

Argument.name: remindersRemaining
Argument.Description: The number of reminders remaining after this one. Passed as a String.

Argument.name: oldDueDate
Argument.Description: The former due date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: newDueDate
Argument.Description: The new due date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: nowDate
Argument.Description: The current date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: created
Argument.Description: The date the work item was created, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: expiration
Argument.Description: The optional date the work item completely expires, passed as a java.util.Date.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Escalated Work Item

EmailTemplate.name: Work Item Comment
EmailTemplate.Body:
Comment added to work item "$workItemName" by $commentAuthor on $spTools.formatDate($commentDate,3,1)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!commentText
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying the requester/owner of a work item that a new comment has been added.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object on which the comment was added.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The name (also the description) of the WorkItem.

Argument.name: comment
Argument.Description: The Comment object with information about the comment.

Argument.name: commentAuthor
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that made the comment.

Argument.name: commentDate
Argument.Description: The date the comment was made, represented as a java.util.Date object.

Argument.name: commentText
Argument.Description: The text of the comment.

EmailTemplate.Subject: New comments added to work item "$workItemName"

EmailTemplate.name: Work Item Forward
EmailTemplate.Body:
$requester forwarded work item "$workItemName" from $previousOwner to $newOwner on $spTools.formatDate($forwardDate,3,1)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!commentText
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying the requester/new owner of a work item that it has been forwarded.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object being forwarded.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The name (also the description) of the WorkItem on which a comment was added.

Argument.name: previousOwner
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that was the previous owner of the work item.

Argument.name: newOwner
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that is the new owner of the work item.

Argument.name: requester
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the forwarding.

Argument.name: forwardDate
Argument.Description: The date the forwarding was requested, represented as a java.util.Date object.

Argument.name: commentText
Argument.Description: Comments about the forwarding.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Work item "$workItemName" forwarded

EmailTemplate.name: Mitigation Expiration
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying certifiers that a mitigation they requested has expired.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The full name (first and last) of the Identity object that has the mitigation.

Argument.name: itemDescription
Argument.Description: A short description of the item that was mitigated.

Argument.name: mitigationExpiration
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.MitigationExpiration that is sending this notification.

Argument.name: mitigator
Argument.Description: The full name (first and last) of the Identity that created the mitigation.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: Comments from the expired mitigation.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Allowed exception has expired for $!identityName

EmailTemplate.name: Policy Violation
EmailTemplate.Body: A violation of policy '$policyName' rule '$constraintName' was detected on user '$identityName'.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying policy owners of violations.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity object that has the violation.

Argument.name: policy
Argument.Description: The Policy object containing the constraint that was violated.

Argument.name: constraint
Argument.Description: A subclass of BaseConstraint representing the policy rule that was violated.

Argument.name: violation
Argument.Description: The PolicyViolation object created to represent the violation.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity object that has the violation.

Argument.name: policyName
Argument.Description: The name of the Policy object.

Argument.name: constraintName
Argument.Description: The name of the constraint (aka rule) within the policy.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Policy violation by $identityName

EmailTemplate.name: Policy Violation Delegation
EmailTemplate.Body: A violation of policy '$violation.policyName' rule '$violation.constraintName' for user '$violation.identity.name' has been delegated to you for action.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying users of the delegation of a policy violation.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object representing the delegation.

Argument.name: violation
Argument.Description: The PolicyViolation object being delegated.

Argument.name: actor
Argument.Description: The Identity object performing the delegation.

Argument.name: description
Argument.Description: A short description of the violation.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: Comments from the actor about the delegation.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Policy violation on $violation.identity.name

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Period Start
EmailTemplate.Body: The challenge period has started for '$certificationName'. You will be notified if any certification decisions are challenged by the affected user.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying certification owners that the challenge period has started.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification beginning the challenge period.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge period started for '$certificationName'

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Period End
EmailTemplate.Body: The challenge period has ended for '$certificationName'. Login to IdentityIQ to complete and sign off on the certification.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying certification owners that the challenge period has ended.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification beginning the challenge period.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge period ended for '$certificationName'

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Creation Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
It has been determined that your access to '$challengeItem' will be limited or removed completely. You have $timeRemaining to challenge this decision.
Click on this link to challenge the decision: http://localhost:8080/identityiq/user/challenge.jsf?id=$challengeId
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger that they can challenge a certification decision.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the item being challenged.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the certification.

Argument.name: entityName
Argument.Description: The name of the item being challenged.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: A short description of the item being challenged.

Argument.name: timeRemaining
Argument.Description: The time remaining in the challenge period, formatted as a string.

Argument.name: challengeId
Argument.Description: The database id of the WorkItem representing the challenge.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Access being removed or limited for '$challengeItem'

EmailTemplate.name: Account Group Challenge Creation Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
It has been determined that permissions on account group '$entityName' will be limited or removed completely. You have $timeRemaining to challenge this decision.
Click on this link to challenge the decision: http://localhost:8080/identityiq/user/challenge.jsf?id=$challengeId
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger that they can challenge a certification decision.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the item being challenged.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the certification.

Argument.name: entityName
Argument.Description: The name of the item being challenged.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: A short description of the item being challenged.

Argument.name: timeRemaining
Argument.Description: The time remaining in the challenge period, formatted as a string.

Argument.name: challengeId
Argument.Description: The database id of the WorkItem representing the challenge.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Access being removed or limited for '$entityName'

EmailTemplate.name: Certification Decision Challenged Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
$challengerName has challenged the decision for '$challengeItem' in $certificationName.
Comments from $challengerName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!challengeComments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please login to IdentityIQ to accept or reject this challenge.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a certifier that a decision has been challenged.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: The shortDescription property of the CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification object containing the item being challenged.

Argument.name: challengerName
Argument.Description: The full name (first and last) of the Identity that made the challenge.

Argument.name: challengeComments
Argument.Description: Comments from the challenger.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Certification decision for '$challengeItem' challenged

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Accepted
EmailTemplate.Body:
$certifierName has accepted the challenge for '$challengeItem' and will change the decision.
Comments from $certifierName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!decisionComments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger that their challenge was accepted.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: The shortDescription property of the CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: decisionComments
Argument.Description: Comments to the challenger.

Argument.name: certifierName
Argument.Description: The full name (first and last) of the Identity that accepted the challenge.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge accepted for '$challengeItem'

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Rejected
EmailTemplate.Body:
$certifierName has rejected the challenge for '$challengeItem'. The decision will remain.
Comments from $certifierName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!rejectionComments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger that their challenge was rejected.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: The shortDescription property of the CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: rejectionComments
Argument.Description: Comments to the challenger.

Argument.name: certifierName
Argument.Description: The full name (first and last) of the Identity that rejected the challenge.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge rejected for '$challengeItem'

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Expiration
EmailTemplate.Body: The challenge period for '$challengeItem' has expired. This certification decision can no longer be contested.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger that they can no longer challenge a certification decision.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: The short description of the CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the certification containing the item being challenged.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge expired for '$challengeItem'

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Decision Expiration
EmailTemplate.Body: The challenge period for the challenged item '$challengeItem' has expired without the certifier accepting or rejecting the challenge. The original decision will stay.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger and certifier that an item that was challenged was not acted upon (accepted or rejected) by the time the challenge period expired, so the decision will stay.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: The short description of the CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the certification containing the item being challenged.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge decision expired for '$challengeItem'

EmailTemplate.name: Open Certifications
EmailTemplate.Body:
Dear $certifier,
You have $certification_count certification(s) outstanding. Please login to IdentityIQ to complete your certifications.
Sincerely, The Recertification Admin Team
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a manager/app owner that they have open certifications outstanding. This is an "instant" email sent on demand from the certification dashboard components. See EmailBean and Emailer.compileOpenCertEmail for context.

Argument.name: certifierName
Argument.Description: The full name (first and last) of the Identity that owns certifications.

Argument.name: certificationCount
Argument.Description: The number of certifications the identity owns, passed as a String.

EmailTemplate.Subject: $certification_count Certification(s) Outstanding

EmailTemplate.name: Task Result Signoff
EmailTemplate.Body:
Dear $owner,
You have been requested to signoff on a $objectType result named: $objectName. Please login to IdentityIQ to perform the signoff.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a signer of a task or report result.

Argument.name: ownerName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that owns the task result and is expected to sign off.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that launched the task.

Argument.name: objectName
Argument.Description: The name of the TaskResult object.

Argument.name: objectType
Argument.Description: Set to "report" if this is a report result or "task" if this is a general task result.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Signoff for $objectType $objectName

EmailTemplate.name: Default Report Template
EmailTemplate.Body: Please find the requested report file(s) attached to this email.
EmailTemplate.Description: Default email template for sending report results. NOTE: There are no input arguments for this template, the report is sent as a PDF and/or csv attachment.
EmailTemplate.Subject: IdentityIQ Report

EmailTemplate.name: Provisioning Form Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
A provisioning form for user $identityDisplayName needs to be completed before the provisioning request can be completed.
Please login to IdentityIQ and view your work item inbox to complete this form at your earliest convenience.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying users when they have provisioning forms to complete. This is used by the Do Provisioning Forms workflow subprocess. Note that in addition to the declared arguments, all workflow variables, Step arguments, and Approval arguments defined in the Workflow are also available.

Argument.name: workflow
Argument.Description: The Workflow object being executed.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The WorkItem representing the review.

Argument.name: launcher
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that launched the workflow.

Argument.name: identityDisplayName
Argument.Description: The display name (usually full name) of the Identity that is the target of the provisioning.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Provisioning Form for $identityDisplayName pending completion

EmailTemplate.name: Account Selection Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
The accounts that are being targeted for changes must be selected for $identityDisplayName before the provisioning request can be completed.
Please login to IdentityIQ and view your work item inbox to complete this form at your earliest convenience.
EmailTemplate.Description:
Email Template for notifying users when they need to select which accounts a provisioning request should apply to when a user has multiple accounts on an application.
This is used by the Do Provisioning Forms workflow subprocess. Note that in addition to the declared arguments, all workflow variables, Step arguments, and Approval arguments defined in the Workflow are also available.

Argument.name: workflow
Argument.Description: The Workflow object being executed.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The WorkItem representing the account selection.

Argument.name: launcher
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that launched the workflow.

Argument.name: identityDisplayName
Argument.Description: The display name (usually full name) of the Identity that is the target of the provisioning.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that is the target of the provisioning.

Argument.name: accounts
Argument.Description: A list of AccountSelection objects for the accounts that need to be selected.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Account selection required for $identityDisplayName

EmailTemplate.name: Work Item Assignment
EmailTemplate.Body: #if ($requesterName) $requesterName #{else} The system #{end} has assigned the following work item to you: $workItemName.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying work item assignee that they have been assigned a work item.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The WorkItem that is being reassigned.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property of the WorkItem.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the assignment.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Work item assigned: $workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Work Item Assignment Removal
EmailTemplate.Body: #if ($requesterName) $requesterName #{else} The system #{end} has removed the following work item from your queue: $workItemName.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying work item assignee that a workitem has been removed from their queue.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The WorkItem that is being reassigned.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property of the WorkItem.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the assignment.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Work item assignment removed: $workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Remediation Item Assignment
EmailTemplate.Body: #if ($requesterName) $requesterName #{else} The system #{end} has assigned the following remediation item to you: $remediationItemName. This item is contained within the work item $workItemName.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying remediation item assignee that they have been assigned a remediation item.

Argument.name: remediationItem
Argument.Description: The RemediationItem that is being reassigned.

Argument.name: remediationItemName
Argument.Description: The description property of the remediationItem.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The parent WorkItem of the RemediationItem being reassigned.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property of the WorkItem.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the assignment.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Remediation item assigned: $workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Remediation Item Assignment Removal
EmailTemplate.Body: #if ($requesterName) $requesterName #{else} The system #{end} has removed the following remediation item from your queue: $remediationItemName. This item is contained within the work item $workItemName.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying remediation item assignee that a remediation item has been removed from their queue.

Argument.name: remediationItem
Argument.Description: The RemediationItem that is being reassigned.

Argument.name: remediationItemName
Argument.Description: The description property of the remediationItem.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The parent WorkItem of the RemediationItem being reassigned.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property of the WorkItem.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the assignment.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Remediation item assignment removed: $workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Access Request Reminder
EmailTemplate.Body: You have a pending work item that requires attention. Work Item: $workItemDescription
EmailTemplate.Description: Email template used to notify work item owner of pending work item for access request.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property (also the name property) of the request WorkItem.

Argument.name: workItemDescription
Argument.Description: The WorkItem description.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object for the request.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Access Request requires completion of Work Item ID : $workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Task Status
EmailTemplate.Body:
The '$taskName' task#if ($status == "Success" ) ended successfully.#{end}#if ($status == "Warning" ) ended with warning.#{end}#if ($status == "Terminated" ) terminated.#{end}#if ($status == "Error" ) ended with error.#{end}
Started : $spTools.formatDate($taskStartTime,3,1) Completed : $spTools.formatDate($taskEndTime,3,1)
#foreach ($msg in $message) $msg #end
For more details, please check - http://localhost:8080/identityiq/monitor/tasks/renderResults.jsf?TaskResultId=$resultId
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying result of Task.

Argument.name: taskResult
Argument.Description: Task Result

Argument.name: taskName
Argument.Description: Task Name

Argument.name: taskDesc
Argument.Description: Task Description

Argument.name: taskStartTime
Argument.Description: Time when task is started

Argument.name: taskEndTime
Argument.Description: Time when task is completed.

Argument.name: status
Argument.Description: Task Status

Argument.name: message
Argument.Description: List of Messages

Argument.name: resultId
Argument.Description: Task Result Id

EmailTemplate.Subject: Task $taskName Status - $status

EmailTemplate.name: Report Completion
EmailTemplate.Body: Your report '$reportName' has completed. You may retrieve your report by clicking on the Report Results tab under Analyze -> Reports.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying report scheduler that the report execution is complete.

Argument.name: reportName
Argument.Description: Name of the report that was completed

EmailTemplate.Subject: Report execution complete

EmailTemplate.name: Alert Notification
EmailTemplate.Body: Alert '$alert.name'#if ($alert.displayName != null) ['$alert.displayName']#{end} has been received#if ($alert.targetType != null ) for '$alert.targetType' '$alert.targetDisplayName'#{end}.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying configured user(s) when an Alert has been acted upon.

Argument.name: alert
Argument.Description: The alert object being acted upon.

Argument.name: alertDefinitionName
Argument.Description: Name of the Alert Definition triggering the action.

Argument.name: errorMessage
Argument.Description: Optional message containing more meaningful insight upon error

EmailTemplate.Subject: Alert Notification

EmailTemplate.name: Sunset Expiration Reminder
EmailTemplate.Body: #if ($role)Role $role #{else}Entitlement $entitlement #{end}belonging to $requestee which was requested by $requestor will be removed on $sunsetDate
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying the requestee and requestor when a Role or Entitlement is about to be sunsetted.

Argument.name: requestor
Argument.Description: The Identity of the original request to sunset the role or entitlement

Argument.name: requestee
Argument.Description: The Identity that the role or entitlement belongs to

Argument.name: role
Argument.Description: The name of the role

Argument.name: entitlement
Argument.Description: The name of the entitlement

Argument.name: sunsetDate
Argument.Description: The date that the role or entitlement will be removed on

EmailTemplate.Subject: Access Expiration Reminder

EmailTemplate.name: Pending Manual Changes
EmailTemplate.Body:
$launcher is requesting the following changes for '$identityDisplayName' be manually made by you.
#if ( $approvalSet.items ) #foreach ($item in $approvalSet.items) Application: $item.applicationName #if ( $item.nativeIdentity ) Account : $item.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $item.instance ) Instance : $item.instance #end Operation: $item.operation #if ( $item.displayName ) Attribute: $item.displayName #elseif ( $item.name ) Attribute: $item.name #end #if ( $item.displayValue ) Value(s): $item.displayValue #elseif ( $item.csv ) Value(s): $item.csv #end #if ( $item.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $item.requesterComments #end #end #end
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying approvers when they need to do perform an account action manually Note that in addition to the declared arguments, all workflow variables, Step arguments, and Approval arguments defined in the Workflow are also available.

Argument.name: workflow
Argument.Description: The Workflow object being executed.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The WorkItem representing the review.

Argument.name: approvalSet
Argument.Description: The ApprovalSet object contained in the work item.

Argument.name: launcher
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that launched the workflow.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that is being changed.

Argument.name: identityDisplayName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that is being changed.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Changes requested to $identityDisplayName need manual interaction

EmailTemplate.name: Role Modeler - Impact Analysis Review
EmailTemplate.Body:
An impact analysis of role '$roleName' has been assigned to you.
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this review.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying role impact analysis reviewers. Note that in addition to the declared arguments, all workflow variables, Step arguments, and Approval arguments defined in the Workflow are also available.

Argument.name: workflow
Argument.Description: The Workflow object being executed.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The WorkItem representing the review

Argument.name: launcher
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that launched the workflow.

Argument.name: roleName
Argument.Description: The name of the role being analyzed.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Review impact analysis of role: $roleName

EmailTemplate.name: Role Modeler - Approval
EmailTemplate.Body:
An approval is required for a modification of the role '$roleName' made by $launcher.
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this approval.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying role approvers of a new work item. Note that in addition to the declared arguments, all workflow variables, Step arguments, and Approval arguments defined in the Workflow are also available.

Argument.name: workflow
Argument.Description: The Workflow object being executed.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The WorkItem representing the review

Argument.name: launcher
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that launched the workflow.

Argument.name: roleName
Argument.Description: The name of the role being analyzed.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Approve modification to role: $roleName

EmailTemplate.name: LCM Identity Update Approval
EmailTemplate.Body:
$launcher is requesting the following changes for '$identityDisplayName'
#if ( $approvalSet.items ) #foreach ($approvalItem in $approvalSet.items) Application: $approvalItem.applicationName #if ( $approvalItem.nativeIdentity ) Account : $approvalItem.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $approvalItem.instance ) Instance : $approvalItem.instance #end Operation: $approvalItem.operation #if ( $approvalItem.displayName ) Attribute: $approvalItem.displayName #elseif ( $approvalItem.name ) Attribute: $approvalItem.name #end #if ( $approvalItem.displayValue ) Value(s): $approvalItem.displayValue #elseif ( $approvalItem.csv ) Value(s): $approvalItem.csv #end #if ( $item.level ) Priority: $item.level #else Priority: Normal #end #if ( $approvalItem.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $approvalItem.requesterComments #end #end #end
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying approvers when they need to approve a request made through LCM. Note that in addition to the declared arguments, all workflow variables, Step arguments, and Approval arguments defined in the Workflow are also available.

Argument.name: workflow
Argument.Description: The Workflow object being executed.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The WorkItem representing the review.

Argument.name: approvalSet
Argument.Description: The ApprovalSet object contained in the work item.

Argument.name: launcher
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that launched the workflow.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that is being changed.

Argument.name: identityDisplayName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that is being changed.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Changes requested to $identityDisplayName need approval

EmailTemplate.name: LCM User Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
#if ( $approvalSet ) #if ( $approvalSet.hasApproved() ) $launcher requested the following account changes to your identity '$identityDisplayName' and they were APPROVED.
#foreach ($item in $approvalSet.approved) #if ( $item.owner && $item.owner != $launcher ) Approved By: $item.owner #end #if ( $item.comments) #foreach ($comment in $item.comments) Completion Comments: $comment #end #end Application: $item.applicationName #if ( $item.nativeIdentity ) Account : $item.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $item.instance ) Instance : $item.instance #end Operation: $item.operation #if ( $item.displayName ) Attribute: $item.displayName #elseif ( $item.name ) Attribute: $item.name #end #if ( $item.displayValue ) Value(s): $item.displayValue #elseif ( $item.csv ) Value(s): $item.csv #end #if ( $item.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $item.requesterComments #end
#end #end #if ( $approvalSet.hasRejected() ) $launcher requested the following account changes to your identity '$identityDisplayName' and they were REJECTED.
#foreach ($item in $approvalSet.rejected) Rejected By: $item.rejecters #if ( $item.comments) #foreach ($comment in $item.comments) Completion Comments: $comment #end #end Application: $item.applicationName #if ( $item.nativeIdentity ) Account : $item.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $item.instance ) Instance : $item.instance #end Operation: $item.operation #if ( $item.displayName ) Attribute: $item.displayName #elseif ( $item.name ) Attribute: $item.name #end #if ( $item.displayValue ) Value(s): $item.displayValue #elseif ( $item.csv ) Value(s): $item.csv #end #if ( $item.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $item.requesterComments #end
#end #end ## ## Handle case where the items are not approved or rejected when the ## approvalScheme is none. ## #if ( $approvalScheme == "none" ) $launcher requested the following account changes to your identity '$identityDisplayName' and the request required no approval because approvals are disabled.
#foreach ($item in $approvalSet.items) #if ( $item.comments) #foreach ($comment in $item.comments) Completion Comments: $comment #end #end Application: $item.applicationName #if ( $item.nativeIdentity ) Account : $item.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $item.instance ) Instance : $item.instance #end Operation: $item.operation #if ( $item.displayName ) Attribute: $item.displayName #elseif ( $item.name ) Attribute: $item.name #end #if ( $item.displayValue ) Value(s): $item.displayValue #elseif ( $item.csv ) Value(s): $item.csv #end #if ( $item.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $item.requesterComments #end #end #end #end
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying users when accounts have been changed through Life Cycle Manager. Note that in addition to the declared arguments, all workflow variables, Step arguments, and Approval arguments defined in the Workflow are also available.

Argument.name: workflow
Argument.Description: The Workflow object being executed.

Argument.name: approvalSet
Argument.Description: The ApprovalSet object contained in the workflow.

Argument.name: launcher
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that launched the workflow.

Argument.name: identityDisplayName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that is being changed.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Changes to your Identity were processed

EmailTemplate.name: LCM Requester Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
#if ( $approvalSet ) #if ( $approvalSet.hasApproved() ) The following changes you requested for identity '$identityDisplayName' were APPROVED.
#foreach ($item in $approvalSet.approved) #if ( $item.owner && $item.owner != $launcher ) Approved By: $item.owner #end #if ( $item.comments) #foreach ($comment in $item.comments) Completion Comments: $comment #end #end Application: $item.applicationName #if ( $item.nativeIdentity ) Account : $item.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $item.instance ) Instance : $item.instance #end Operation: $item.operation #if ( $item.displayName ) Attribute: $item.displayName #elseif ( $item.name ) Attribute: $item.name #end #if ( $item.displayValue ) Value(s): $item.displayValue #elseif ( $item.csv ) Value(s): $item.csv #end #if ( $item.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $item.requesterComments #end
#end #end #if ( $approvalSet.hasRejected() ) The following changes you requested for identity '$identityDisplayName' were REJECTED.
#foreach ($item in $approvalSet.rejected) Rejected By: $item.rejecters #if ( $item.comments) #foreach ($comment in $item.comments) Completion Comments: $comment #end #end Application: $item.applicationName #if ( $item.nativeIdentity ) Account : $item.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $item.instance ) Instance : $item.instance #end Operation: $item.operation #if ( $item.displayName ) Attribute: $item.displayName #elseif ( $item.name ) Attribute: $item.name #end #if ( $item.displayValue ) Value(s): $item.displayValue #elseif ( $item.csv ) Value(s): $item.csv #end #if ( $item.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $item.requesterComments #end
#end #end ## ## Handle case where the items are not approved or rejected when the ## approvalScheme is none. ## #if ( $approvalScheme == "none" ) The following are the changes you requested for identity '$identityDisplayName' and the request required no approval because approvals are disabled.
#foreach ($item in $approvalSet.items) #if ( $item.comments) #foreach ($comment in $item.comments) Completion Comments: $comment #end #end Application: $item.applicationName #if ( $item.nativeIdentity ) Account : $item.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $item.instance ) Instance : $item.instance #end Operation: $item.operation #if ( $item.displayName ) Attribute: $item.displayName #elseif ( $item.name ) Attribute: $item.name #end #if ( $item.displayValue ) Value(s): $item.displayValue #elseif ( $item.csv ) Value(s): $item.csv #end #if ( $item.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $item.requesterComments #end #end #end #end

EmailTemplate.Body:
#if ( $approvalSet ) #if ( $approvalSet.hasApproved() ) $launcher requested the following account changes for employee '$identityDisplayName' and they were APPROVED.
#foreach ($item in $approvalSet.approved) #if ( $item.owner && $item.owner != $launcher ) Approved By: $item.owner #end #if ( $item.comments) #foreach ($comment in $item.comments) Completion Comments: $comment #end #end Application: $item.applicationName #if ( $item.nativeIdentity ) Account : $item.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $item.instance ) Instance : $item.instance #end Operation: $item.operation #if ( $item.displayName ) Attribute: $item.displayName #elseif ( $item.name ) Attribute: $item.name #end #if ( $item.displayValue ) Value(s): $item.displayValue #elseif ( $item.csv ) Value(s): $item.csv #end #if ( $item.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $item.requesterComments #end
#end #end #if ( $approvalSet.hasRejected() ) $launcher requested the following account changes for employee '$identityDisplayName' and they were REJECTED.
#foreach ($item in $approvalSet.rejected) Rejected By: $item.rejecters #if ( $item.comments) #foreach ($comment in $item.comments) Completion Comments: $comment #end #end Application: $item.applicationName #if ( $item.nativeIdentity ) Account : $item.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $item.instance ) Instance : $item.instance #end Operation: $item.operation #if ( $item.displayName ) Attribute: $item.displayName #elseif ( $item.name ) Attribute: $item.name #end #if ( $item.displayValue ) Value(s): $item.displayValue #elseif ( $item.csv ) Value(s): $item.csv #end #if ( $item.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $item.requesterComments #end
#end #end ## ## Handle case where the items are not approved or rejected when the ## approvalScheme is none. ## #if ( $approvalScheme == "none" ) $launcher requested the following changes for employee '$identityDisplayName' and the request required no approval because approvals are disabled.
#foreach ($item in $approvalSet.items) #if ( $item.comments) #foreach ($comment in $item.comments) Completion Comments: $comment #end #end Application: $item.applicationName #if ( $item.nativeIdentity ) Account : $item.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $item.instance ) Instance : $item.instance #end Operation: $item.operation #if ( $item.displayName ) Attribute: $item.displayName #elseif ( $item.name ) Attribute: $item.name #end #if ( $item.displayValue ) Value(s): $item.displayValue #elseif ( $item.csv ) Value(s): $item.csv #end #if ( $item.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $item.requesterComments #end #end #end #end
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying managers when an employee's account(s) are modified. Note that in addition to the declared arguments, all workflow variables, Step arguments, and Approval arguments defined in the Workflow are also available.

EmailTemplate.Body:
$launcher is requesting approval to run in a batch request file.
#if ( $approvalSet.items ) #foreach ($item in $approvalSet.items) Content Preview: $item.displayValue #end #end
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying approvers when they need to approve a request made through LCM. Note that in addition to the declared arguments, all workflow variables, Step arguments, and Approval arguments defined in the Workflow are also available.

EmailTemplate.name: LCM Registration User Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
#if ( $approvalSet ) #if ( $approvalSet.hasApproved() ) The following registration request for your identity '$identityDisplayName' was APPROVED.
#foreach ($item in $approvalSet.approved) #if ( $item.owner && $item.owner != $launcher ) Approved By: $item.owner #end #if ( $item.comments) #foreach ($comment in $item.comments) Completion Comments: $comment #end #end Application: $item.applicationName #if ( $item.nativeIdentity ) Account : $item.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $item.instance ) Instance : $item.instance #end Operation: $item.operation #if ( $item.displayName ) Attribute: $item.displayName #elseif ( $item.name ) Attribute: $item.name #end #if ( $item.displayValue ) Value(s): $item.displayValue #elseif ( $item.csv ) Value(s): $item.csv #end #if ( $item.requesterComments ) Requester Comments: $item.requesterComments #end

EmailTemplate.name: Native Account Change Manager Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
IdentityIQ detected the following native changes on your accounts:
#if ( $event.nativeChanges) #foreach ($change in $event.nativeChanges)
Operation : $change.operation Application: $change.applicationName #if ( $change.nativeIdentity ) Account : $change.nativeIdentity #end #if ( $change.instance ) Instance : $change.instance #end #if ( $change.differences ) #foreach ($difference in $change.differences) Attribute : $difference.attribute #if ( not $difference.multi) #if ( $difference.newValue ) New Value(s) : $difference.newValue #end #end #if ( $difference.multi) #if ( $difference.addedValues ) Added Value(s) : $difference.addedValues #end #if ( $difference.removedValues ) Removed Value(s) : $difference.removedValues #end #end #end #end #end #end

Field.name: workItemHoursBetweenReminders
Field.Description:
This is the value required by the Workflow engine, using the field above convert the days into hours.
Workflow.ARG_WORK_ITEM_HOURS_BETWEEN_REMINDERS

Field.name: workItemHoursTillEscalation
Field.Description:
This is required for both escallation AND reminders, don't let the attribute name fool you.
The way it works is that the WorkItem has to sit for hoursTillEscalation before the process begins.
Then a "clock" starts and on each tick we first send reminders up to maxReminders, then we run the escalation rule to change owners. After the owner change we send reminders again on each tick up to maxReminders and then run the escalation rule again.
If the approvalEscalation == sendReminders OR reminderEsclate we use the workItemDaysBeforeReminderField field If the approvalEscalation == escalateOnly we use the workItemDaysTillEscalationField field
We ignore negative number conversion because that represent seconds.

RoleTypeDefinition.name: organizational
RoleTypeDefinition.Description: Defines a collection of roles that typically correspond to departments or business units within an organizational hierarchy.

RoleTypeDefinition.name: business
RoleTypeDefinition.Description: Defines a collection of users that perform similar functions within the organization. Business Roles are associated with IT Roles or Entitlement Roles to provide specific levels of access to enterprise IT resources.

RoleTypeDefinition.name: it
RoleTypeDefinition.Description: Defines a collection of IT entitlements which can be associated with Business Roles to provide users with specific access rights. IT Roles can be constrained to entitlements within a single application or expanded to include entitlements across applications.

RoleTypeDefinition.name: entitlement
RoleTypeDefinition.Description: Defines a single IT entitlement necessary to access data or perform a specific action within a target system.

Argument.name: requestee
Argument.Description: Identity on whose behalf the Life Cycle Manager request is being made. In the case of bulk requests, this argument will be set to null when determining the roles that are visible to the requestor. It will be provided once a selection has been made in order to determine whether or not the given requestee should have access to the selected role.

Rule.name: CEFActivityCorrelation
Rule.Description: Rule to show how an CEF activity might be correlated back to an identity. In most cases, this rule will be providing enought information to the correlator so that it can find the Application link. In some cases, it might also be desireable to return something that points back to an Identity, which is also supported.

Argument.name: log
Argument.Description: The log object associated with the SailPointContext.

Argument.name: context
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.api.SailPointContext object that can be used to query the database if necessary.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application where the activity was generated. An application may have more then one data source.

Argument.name: datasource
Argument.Description: The data source that returned the activity.

Argument.name: activity
Argument.Description: The activity object that was normalized by the data source and that we are trying to correlate back to one of our Identities.

Argument.name: linkIdentity
Argument.Description: A string that represents the link's identity attribute.

Argument.name: linkName
Argument.Description: A string that represents the link's displayName attribute.

Argument.name: linkAttributeName
Argument.Description: A string that represents the NAME of an attribute that can be used to find the Link that maps back to this activity. This attribute must also be supplied with the linkAttributeValue variable.

Argument.name: linkAttributeValue
Argument.Description: A string that represents the VALUE of an attribute that can be used to find the Link that maps back to this activity. This attribute must also be supplied with the linkAttributeName variable.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The name of an Identity object.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: A fully resolved Identity object in case the rule wants to do its own queries to locate the identity.

Argument.name: identityAttributeName
Argument.Description: The name of the extended attribute that can be used to locate an existing identity.

Argument.name: identityAttributeValue
Argument.Description: The value of the named extended attribute that can be used to locate an existing identity. This attribute is used together with the identityAttributeName argument.

Rule.name: Application Builder
Rule.Description: A rule to build and manipulate IdentityIQ application in a bulk. All duties are mentioned below. 1. When create mode is selected, then it creates multiple application in a bulk by parsing csv file. 2. When update mode is selected, then it updates the attribute map of existing application by parsing input csv file. 3. When read mode is selected, then it reads all existing IdentityIQ application and export them to csv file. Exports considers only attributes of the application.

Argument.name: context
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.api.SailPointContext object that can be used to query the database to save application object and task definitions.

Argument.name: log
Argument.Description: The log object for logging.

Argument.name: inputParams
Argument.Description: The input params object is map of attributes received from Task UI.

Argument.name: taskResult
Argument.Description: The task result object required for updating the result.
