TaskDefinition.name: Account Aggregation
TaskDefinition.Description: Task template for application account scanning.

TaskDefinition.name: Identity Refresh
TaskDefinition.Description: Template for identity refresh scans.

Argument.name: promoteAttributes
Argument.Description: When true, the identity attributes will be recalculated from the application attributes.

Argument.name: refreshManagerStatus
Argument.Description: When true, the manager status for the identities will be refreshed. The manager status is true for an identity if there is any other identity that references the first identity as a manager.

TaskDefinition.name: Sequential Task Launcher
TaskDefinition.Description: Template for creating a task that runs multiple other tasks.

TaskDefinition.name: System Maintenance
TaskDefinition.Description: Prune identity snapshots, task results, and certifications. Perform other background maintenance tasks.

TaskDefinition.name: Identity Request Maintenance
TaskDefinition.Description: Prune and Verify Identity Request objects.

TaskDefinition.name: Encrypted Data Synchronization Task
TaskDefinition.Description: A task that can be used to re-encrypt all encrypted data using the newest key in the keystore. It can be used to change the public/private keys that can be used for IQService comm. It also can be used to convert all encrypted identity secrets to hashing, including Identity password, Identity and application password history, authentication question answers.

TaskDefinition.name: IQService Public Key Exchange Task
TaskDefinition.Description: A task that can be used used to change the public keys that are used for IQService communications.

TaskDefinition.name: Effective Access Indexing
TaskDefinition.Description: Calculate the indirect target associations (Tcodes, etc.) for entitlements and roles.

TaskDefinition.name: Alert Aggregation
TaskDefinition.Description: Aggregate Alert Objects from External Sources and optionally process.

TaskDefinition.name: Alert Processor
TaskDefinition.Description: Process Alerts previously aggregated from Alert Aggregation.

TaskDefinition.name: Activity Aggregation
TaskDefinition.Description: Template for activity scanning. This task will iterate over an application's activity datasource, correlate the activity back to an Identity and then store the correlated activities.

Argument.name: correlated
Argument.Description: The total number of activities correlated to identities.

Argument.name: uncorrrelated
Argument.Description: The total number of activities not correlated to identities.

Argument.name: filtered
Argument.Description: The total number of activities ignored.

TaskDefinition.name: Propagate Role Changes
TaskDefinition.Description: Template for role propagation.

TaskDefinition.name: Policy Scan
TaskDefinition.Description: Template for policy scanning.

TaskDefinition.name: Cancel Certification Group
TaskDefinition.Description: Template task for canceling a certification group.

Argument.name: certificationGroupId
Argument.Description: The id of the certification group to cancel.

TaskDefinition.name: Activate Certification Group
TaskDefinition.Description: Template task for activating a staged certification group.

Argument.name: certificationGroupId
Argument.Description: The id of the certification group to activate.

TaskDefinition.name: Apply Certification Definition Changes
TaskDefinition.Description: Task for applying changes made to a CertificationDefinition to the related Certifications and WorkItems.

Argument.name: certificationGroupId
Argument.Description: The id of the certification group to update.

TaskDefinition.name: Certification Manager
TaskDefinition.Description: Template Task for scheduling access certifications.

Argument.name: certifier
Argument.Description: Username that will be assigned as the certifier for this Manager access certification.

Argument.name: identities
Argument.Description: List of identity ids for use with creating an individual certification

Argument.name: identityManagers
Argument.Description: String representation of a mapping of identities to managers for individually assigned certifications

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: Application that will be assigned as the application for this App access certification.

Argument.name: certifiedApplicationIds
Argument.Description: A comma-separated string of application IDs to certify for an application owner certification.

Argument.name: certificationType
Argument.Description: Type of Access Certification to Run.

Argument.name: duration
Argument.Description: Date that the access certification will expire

Argument.name: creator
Argument.Description: Username of the person who created this access certification.

Argument.name: sendReminders
Argument.Description: "true" or "false" flag on whether to send reminders when the certification expires.

TaskDefinition.name: Target Aggregation
TaskDefinition.Description: Template Task for running target aggregations.

Argument.name: total
Argument.Description: The total number of targets processed.

Argument.name: correlated
Argument.Description: The total number of targets that correlated to one or more objects.

Argument.name: uncorrelated
Argument.Description: The total number of targets that did not correlate to any objects.

Argument.name: mappingsProcessed
Argument.Description: The total number of Access Mappings processed

Argument.name: targetsDeleted
Argument.Description: The total number of Targets Deleted

Argument.name: associationsDeleted
Argument.Description: The total number of TargetAssociations deleted

Argument.name: deleteTime
Argument.Description: Time spent deleting old targets

Argument.name: associationDeleteTime
Argument.Description: Time spent deleting old TargetAssociations

Argument.name: processTime
Argument.Description: Time spent processing targets

Argument.name: adornmentTime
Argument.Description: Time spent adorning targets to cubes and account groups

TaskDefinition.name: Account Group Aggregation
TaskDefinition.Description: Task template for application group scanning.

TaskDefinition.name: Missing Managed Entitlements Scan
TaskDefinition.Description: Creates missing managed entitlement objects for the applications specified.

TaskDefinition.name: ITIM Application Creator
TaskDefinition.Description: Automatically creates ITIM account applications using connection information from an authoritative ITIM application.

TaskDefinition.name: Role Index Refresh
TaskDefinition.Description: Analyzes each role in the system and collects statistics about them into a role index.

TaskDefinition.name: Entitlement Role Generator
TaskDefinition.Description: Automatically creates an Entitlement Role for every entitlement found in the specified application(s)

TaskDefinition.name: Hidden Missing Managed Entitlements Scan
TaskDefinition.Description: Creates missing managed entitlement objects for the applications specified.

TaskDefinition.name: Impact Analysis
TaskDefinition.Description: System task for performing impact analysis of role or profile changes.

TaskDefinition.name: Policy Impact Analysis
TaskDefinition.Description: System task for performing impact analysis of policy changes.

TaskDefinition.name: Workflow Launcher
TaskDefinition.Description: Workflow Case

TaskDefinition.name: Business Role Mining
TaskDefinition.Description: Mine Business Roles based on organizational and functional identity attributes

Argument.name: tieredIdentityMiningAttrs
Argument.Prompt: Comma-separated list of identity mining attributes (required).

Argument.name: genContainerRole
Argument.Prompt: Place mined business roles into auto-generated organizational roles using top-tier attribute.

Argument.name: containerRole
Argument.Prompt: Place mined roles into single, pre-existing Container Role.

Argument.name: bfrPrefix
Argument.Prompt: Optional prefix to apply to all mined role names.

Argument.name: minimumRoleSize
Argument.Prompt: Minimum number of users in each mined role.

Argument.name: createSubRoles
Argument.Prompt: Use sub-roles in the mining process (optional).

Argument.name: uidNaming
Argument.Prompt: Use generic uid naming for mined roles (default: filter-based naming).

Argument.name: simulate
Argument.Prompt: Perform What-If mining analysis (no roles are created).

Argument.name: mineITRoles
Argument.Prompt: Mine for IT entitlements on each generated Business Functional Role (optional).

Argument.name: applications
Argument.Prompt: If mining for IT Roles, the Application(s) whose entitlements will be mined.

Argument.name: threshold
Argument.Prompt: If mining for IT Roles, the percentage threshold for inclusion of an entitlement.

Argument.name: itRoleAssociation
Argument.Prompt: Associate the mined IT Role to the BFR using "required" policy (default is "permits").

Argument.name: attachITProfiles
Argument.Prompt: Attach mined IT profiles to BFR instead of creating an IT role.

TaskDefinition.name: IT Role Mining
TaskDefinition.Description: IT Role Mining based on a Group Definition, List of applications and threshold.

Argument.name: roleName
Argument.Prompt: Business Role to Mine. Select if you want an existing Business Role to be mined

Argument.name: newRoleName
Argument.Prompt: New Business Role Name. Enter if you want to create a new Business Role

Argument.name: defaultOwner
Argument.Prompt: Default Business Role Owner. If creating new Business Role, enter default owner

Argument.name: containerRole
Argument.Prompt: Place mined role into pre-existing Container Role.

Argument.name: filter
Argument.Prompt: Optional Filter to select Identities. Example: department == "Finance"

Argument.name: simulate
Argument.Prompt: Simulate Mining Activity. No Business Roles/Profiles will be created

TaskDefinition.name: New IT Role Mining
TaskDefinition.Description: IT Role Mining based on a population, List of applications/entitlements and thresholds.

Argument.name: identityFilter
Argument.Prompt: Filter that restricts the population of identities to mine roles from.

Argument.name: applications
Argument.Prompt: IDs for Applications that contain the users and entitlements from which roles are mined

Argument.name: includedEntitlements
Argument.Prompt: Entitlements from which to mine roles

Argument.name: minIdentities
Argument.Prompt: Minimum number of identities that must contain a given entitlement set to generate a candidate role

Argument.name: minEntitlements
Argument.Prompt: Mininmum number of entitlements that must be in an entitlement set to generate a candidate role

Argument.name: maxCandidateRoles
Argument.Prompt: Maximum number of candidate roles that will be generated before the task starts discarding data

TaskDefinition.name: Data Export
TaskDefinition.Description: Template for creating a data export task.

TaskDefinition.name: FIM Application Creator
TaskDefinition.Description: Automatically discover and create FIM Management Agent Applications.

TaskDefinition.name: OIM Application Creator
TaskDefinition.Description: Automatically discover and create OIM Resource Applications.

TaskDefinition.name: Complete Orphan Identity Requests
TaskDefinition.Description: Remove identity requests for older completed requests

TaskDefinition.name: Identity IQ Cloud Gateway Synchronization Task
TaskDefinition.Description: Synchronize the specified objects to the Cloud Gateway.

TaskDefinition.name: Run Rule
TaskDefinition.Description: A task that can be used to run an arbitrary rule.

TaskDefinition.name: ArcSight Data Export
TaskDefinition.Description: Template for creating a ArcSight data export task.

TaskDefinition.name: Application Builder
TaskDefinition.Description: A task that can be used to Create, Update, Read multiple IdentityIQ application.

TaskDefinition.name: System Maintenance Object Pruner
TaskDefinition.Description: Prunes expired objects as part of the system maintenance

TaskDefinition.name: New Certification Generator
TaskDefinition.Description: Task that uses the new certification generation framework.

TaskDefinition.name: Refresh Identity Cube
TaskDefinition.Description: Perform a full refresh of all the identities.

TaskDefinition.name: Refresh Logical Accounts
TaskDefinition.Description: Perform a full refresh of all the identities.

Argument.name: promoteAttributes
Argument.Description: When true, the identity attributes will be recalculated from the application attributes.

Argument.name: refreshManagerStatus
Argument.Description: When true, the manager status for the identities will be refreshed. The manager status is true for an identity if there is any other identity that references the first identity as a manager.

TaskDefinition.name: Prune Identity Cubes
TaskDefinition.Description: Delete identities that have no account links and have no important references.

TaskDefinition.name: Perform Maintenance
TaskDefinition.Description: Prune identity snapshots, task results, and certifications. Perform other background maintenance tasks.

TaskDefinition.name: Refresh Application Scores
TaskDefinition.Description: Refresh application scores.

TaskDefinition.name: Refresh Role Scorecard
TaskDefinition.Description: Analyzes each role in the system and collects statistics about them.

TaskDefinition.name: Remove Orphan Role Requests
TaskDefinition.Description: Remove orphaned requests for roles that no longer exist

TaskDefinition.name: Perform Identity Request Maintenance
TaskDefinition.Description: Prune old identity request objects and scan unverified access requests to check for provisioning completeness.

TaskDefinition.name: Upgrade Managed Attributes
TaskDefinition.Description: Upgrade ManagedAttributes to the 6.0 model, and convert AccountGroups to ManagedAttributes.

TaskDefinition.name: Full Text Index Refresh
TaskDefinition.Description: Build full-text indexes for roles and managed attributes.

TaskDefinition.name: Effective Access Index Refresh
TaskDefinition.Description: Calculate the indirect target associations (Tcodes, etc.) for entitlements and roles.

TaskDefinition.name: Refresh Entitlement Correlation
TaskDefinition.Description: Refresh the business role assignments of all identities.

TaskDefinition.name: Refresh Risk Scores
TaskDefinition.Description: Refresh the risk scores of all identities.

TaskDefinition.name: Refresh Role Indexes
TaskDefinition.Description: Refresh the statistics of all roles.

TaskDefinition.name: Refresh Groups
TaskDefinition.Description: Refresh indexes for all identity groups.

TaskDefinition.name: Check Active Policies
TaskDefinition.Description: Check default policies and refresh the policy violation status on each identity.

TaskDefinition.name: Check Expired Work Items
TaskDefinition.Description: Send reminders, escalate, or expire items.

TaskDefinition.name: Check Expired Mitigations
TaskDefinition.Description: Send notifications when mitigations expire.

TaskDefinition.name: Check Sunset Requests
TaskDefinition.Description: Send notifications when a Role with a sunset is approaching expiration

TaskDefinition.name: Role Mining
TaskDefinition.Description: Performs undirected role mining.

TaskDefinition.name: Synchronize Roles
TaskDefinition.Description: Synchronize roles with identity management systems.

TaskDefinition.name: Role Overlap Analysis
TaskDefinition.Description: Run overlap analysis on a selected role.

TaskDefinition.name: Search Report
TaskDefinition.Description: Report created by the user from the analyze identities page.

Argument.name: columns
Argument.Description: rept_input_search_report_columns

Argument.name: filters
Argument.Description: rept_input_search_report_filters

Argument.name: resultScope
Argument.Description: rept_input_result_scope

Argument.name: emailIdentities
Argument.Description: rept_input_email_recips

Argument.name: REPORT_MAX_COUNT
Argument.Description: rept_input_max_rows

TaskDefinition.name: Uncorrelated Accounts Report
TaskDefinition.Description: A detailed view of the uncorrelated user accounts in the system.

Argument.name: correlatedApps
Argument.Description: rept_input_uncorrelated_ident_report_correlated_apps

Argument.name: resultScope
Argument.Description: rept_input_result_scope

Argument.name: emailIdentities
Argument.Description: rept_input_email_recips

TaskDefinition.name: Risky Accounts Report
TaskDefinition.Description: A summary view of risky accounts in the system and the causes of their risk.

Argument.name: applications
Argument.Description: rept_input_identity_app_risk_report_correlated_apps

TaskDefinition.name: Users by Application Report
TaskDefinition.Description: A detailed view of the users in the system categorized by the applications that they belong to.

Argument.name: applications
Argument.Description: rept_input_app_user_report_apps

TaskDefinition.name: Application Account Summary Report
TaskDefinition.Description: Displays a summary of the accounts on each application.

Argument.name: applications
Argument.Description: rept_input_app_accounts_report_apps

TaskDefinition.name: Configured Applications Details Report
TaskDefinition.Description: A detailed view of all configured applications.

Argument.name: applications
Argument.Description: rept_input_app_report_apps

Argument.name: owners
Argument.Description: rept_input_app_report_owners

TaskDefinition.name: Delimited File Application Status Report
TaskDefinition.Description: A detailed view of configured applications and the status of their local file repositories.

Argument.name: applications
Argument.Description: rept_input_app_report_apps

Argument.name: resultScope
Argument.Description: rept_input_result_scope

Argument.name: emailIdentities
Argument.Description: rept_input_email_recips

Argument.name: REPORT_MAX_COUNT
Argument.Description: rept_input_max_rows

TaskDefinition.name: Application Risk Live Report
TaskDefinition.Description: A summary view of the risk of each application and the accounts that factor into that risk.

Argument.name: applications
Argument.Description: rept_input_app_report_apps

Argument.name: owners
Argument.Description: rept_input_app_report_owners

TaskDefinition.name: User Details Report
TaskDefinition.Description: A detailed view of users currently detected by IdentityIQ.

Argument.name: groupDefinitions
Argument.Description: rept_input_user_report_group_definition

Argument.name: capabilities
Argument.Description: rept_input_user_report_capabilities

Argument.name: lastLogin
Argument.Description: rept_input_user_report_last_login

Argument.name: lastRefresh
Argument.Description: rept_input_user_report_last_refresh

Argument.name: identityRoles
Argument.Description: rept_input_user_report_biz_roles

Argument.name: identityApplications
Argument.Description: rept_input_user_report_apps

TaskDefinition.name: Identity Roles Report

RenderScript.Source: import sailpoint.tools.*; return value.equals("assignedRoles") ? Message.localize("rept_id_roles_col_assigned") : Message.localize("rept_id_roles_col_detected");

Reference.name: Identity Entitlement Identity Report Form Customizer

TaskDefinition.Description: Displays the roles that each identity is a member of.

Argument.name: groupDefinitions
Argument.Description: rept_input_user_report_group_definition

Argument.name: capabilities
Argument.Description: rept_input_user_report_capabilities

Argument.name: lastLoginType
Argument.Description: rept_input_user_report_last_login_type

Argument.name: lastLogin
Argument.Description: rept_input_user_report_last_login

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity object being modified.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description:
This attribute is set during the "Build Approval Set" step, which builds this list by going through the ProvisioningPlan to build the line items that need to be approved.
This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. This may be passed in, if not the script queries for this using a projection query and falls back to the name.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: A ProvisioningProject object describing the modifications to the identity. This may include a list of Question objects which will cause the generation of a Form and a WorkItem to solicit additional information necessary for provisioning.

Variable.name: formTemplate
Variable.Description: The name of the Form object that will be the template for generated forms.

Variable.name: preferredOwner
Variable.Description: Optional argument to buildProvisioningForm to pass in the name of an identity we should try to process first when feeding forms back to the workflow. If there are no questions for that identity and there are questions for other identities, a form for one of the other identities is generated at random. When set the value is usually the same as "sessionOwner" a built-in system variable containing the name of the user currently interacting with a workflow session.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: String version of WorkItem.level that will be used to set the priority of any generated workitems.

Variable.name: requiredOwner
Variable.Description:
Optional argument to buildProvisioningForm to pass in the name of an identity we should try to process first when feeding forms back to the workflow. If there are no questions for that identity and there are questions for other identities, no form is returned and the workflow may terminate without answering all of the questions in the project.
This variable should only be on if you want to generate provisioning forms for the requester before approval. When called after approval (from Identity Request Provision), we don't pass in this attribute and all the rest of the provisioning forms can be generated.

Variable.name: fallbackOwner
Variable.Description: Optional argument to specify a fallback identity to own Forms when nothing else is specified.

Variable.name: accountSelectionOwner
Variable.Description: Optional argument to buildAccountSelectionForm to specify identity that owns the Form.

Variable.name: disableManualAccountSelection
Variable.Description: When set to 'true' the system will not send out Account Selection Notification emails for users with more than one account on any one application and the system can't determine the provisioning account. This is only passed in from Identity Refresh workflow.

Variable.name: workItemForm
Variable.Description:
Holds the assembled provisioning form for this user. This is generated dynamically and passed into a work item for presentation. During rendering the new field values are saved in the form fields. When the work item is assimilated, we copy the form from the work item back to this variable for further processing.
Note that this must be named workItemForm if you want to use it in the "send" list of an Approval. This is the name recognized by WorkItemFormBean. If you need to use a different name, or have multiple forms then you will need to use an Arg in the Approval to do the name translation.

Variable.name: formOwnerError
Variable.Description: Set to true if we ever have difficulty determining a form owner. Used to break out of the provisioning loop. This really shouldn't be necessary but be safe.

Variable.name: workItemComments
Variable.Description: Global comments list which should be appended to the comments list ofr each approval.

Variable.name: accountSelectionForm
Variable.Description: Dynamic account selection form generated when target account is ambiguous.

Variable.name: calculatedAccountSelectionOwner
Variable.Description: Calculated owner value for account selection form.

Step.name: Build Account Selection Form
Step.Description: Call the standard handler method to build the account selection form.

Step.name: Present Account Selection Form

Script.Source: // If this is interactive then don't bother sending email notifications. return (null != sessionOwner) && !sessionOwner.equals("System") && !sessionOwner.equals("Scheduler");

Step.Description: Present the account selection form and check to make sure all account selections were made.

Step.name: Handle Old Account Selections

Script.Source: // If this is interactive then don't bother sending email notifications. return (null != sessionOwner) && !sessionOwner.equals("System") && !sessionOwner.equals("Scheduler");

Step.Description: There are two ways to model account selections. Pre 6.3 workflows use a top-level List of AccountSelection objects on the project. 6.3 added a List of ProvisioningTarget objects. We need to handle both, but there will never be a combination of them in the same workflow case. This step handles the old model.

Step.name: Recompile Provisioning Project
Step.Description: Recompile the project.

Step.name: Build Provisioning Form
Step.Description: Call the standard handler method to build the provisioning form from the specified template and question list.

Step.name: Present Provisioning Form
Step.Description: Present the form we calculated in the previous step. TODO: Need something more formal to determine who the owner of this should be.

Step.name: Assimilate Provisioning Form
Step.Description:
Assimilate the results of the provisioning form back into the workflow. This may result in the generation of another set of questions for a different user. Assimilation can also theoretically generate new questions for the same user if some of the template fields had conditional rendering.
You can pass things into the Template and Field scripts by defining Args in this step. You cannot change plan copmiler options, those were specified in the call to compileProvisioningProject and stored in the project for recompilation and execution.
A new project is returned, but actually it will always be the same as the project passed in.

Step.name: Assimilate Account Id Changes
Step.Description: Assimilate the result of any accountId changes that may have been compiled into the plan back onto the ApprovalSet.

Workflow.name: Do Manual Actions

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity object being modified.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. This may be passed in, if not the script queries for this using a projection query and falls back to the name.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: A ProvisioningProject object describing the modifications to the identity.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: String version of WorkItem.level that will be used to set the priority any generated workitems.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: A String that specifies the name of the Identity that will be assigned any approvals where the owner of the approver can't be resolved. Example if the scheme is "owner" and the application doesn't specify and owner.

Variable.name: doAudit
Variable.Description: When true we will audit the completion of manual action work items.

Workflow.Description: Preset the unmanaged portion of a provisioning project as work items to be processed manually. This is used by the Identity Update and Identity Refresh workflows. LCM has a similar step but it audits differently. Need to reconsider this and see if we can share the same subprocess.

Step.name: Manual Actions
Step.Description: Build an Approval structure for the unmanaged plan in the provisioning project. The construtor is in the rule "Build Manual Action Approvals" that expects to be passed launcher, project, identityName, and fallbackApprover.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: Project that will be provisioned.

Variable.name: provisioningRetryThreshold
Variable.Description: The interval in minutes to wait to retry the request defaults to 60 minutes. The retryInterval will be read from the underlying applications involved in the retry provisioning activity and the max interval defined across all applications will be used . If an interval is not specified on any of the Applications we'll fall back to the setting in this variable which defaultws to an hour.

Variable.name: provisioningMaxRetries
Variable.Description:
The maximum number of retries that will be attempted before failure of the provisioning activities. A value of -1 will execute retries indefinetly.
Like provisioningRetry the value will be read from the application, if not defined on the application we'll fall back to this setting which will default to -1.

Variable.name: enableRetryRequest
Variable.Description: When set to true it will disable the retries loop and let the Provision step launch requests to handle the retries. Enabling this flag will enable some older functionality.

Variable.name: foregroundProvisioning
Variable.Description: Normally provisioning is done in a step that uses the "background" option to force the workflow to be suspend and be resumed in a background task thread. This prevents the browser session from hanging since provision can sometimes take a long time. For demos and testing it can be better to do this in the foreground so that provisioning will have been performed when control is returned to the user. This prevents having to run the Perform Maintenance task to see the resutls of the request.

Variable.name: recompileBeforeProvisioning
Variable.Description: True to recompile the project prior to calling the Provisioner. This is useful when background provisioning is enabled, to pick up any changes that might have happened between the time the workflow was backgrounded, and the time in which it is resumed.

Variable.name: disableIdentityRequests
Variable.Description: May be passed by the calling workflow to disable processing of IdentityRequest objects after provisioning. This option should be passed by any workflow that is not used by LCM and does not maintain the IdentityRequest model. This avoids logging a warning when the IdentityRequest is not found.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description: The ID of the IdentityRequest for this request.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this subprocess and when set to true trace statements will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: retries
Variable.Description: The number of retries performed during the execution of the provisioning activities.

Variable.name: retryProject
Variable.Description:
Project that is assembled for retry purposes, the parts of original plan are broken into a separate plan that includes only the account requests that need to be retried.
After each visit to retr this project will be rebuilt after the previous execution results are assimimlated back onto the "main" project.

Variable.name: splitProvisioning
Variable.Description: True to denote this is a partial of the full ProvisioningPlan. This should be true in the case of LCM Provisioning splits.

Step.name: Initialize Retries
Step.Description: When visiting for the first time initalize the retry variable and avoid the sleep that we'll want when looping for retries.

Step.name: Wait for next retry
Step.Description: This is a sleep step and just waits to execute the next step. Typically only called when we are retrying to give us some delay between calls down to the PE. Skipped during the first loop.

Step.name: Provision
Step.Description:
Call the typical provisionProject method during our first time through the workflow. If there are retries this step will be skipped and should fall into the "Retry Provision" step.
The only thing special here is the flag we specify to the PlanEvaluator to prevent the Request object from from being created if there are retries in the project. Then we can handle them directly in the workflow looping until we are complete.

Step.name: Refresh Identity Request
Step.Description:
Refresh the identity request to include provisioning results and any other provisioning side effects in the project.
Note that the disableIdentityRequests input variable is passed to skip request processing if we're being called from a non-LCM workflow. It is easier to pass this option than to transition around this step.

Step.name: Provision Retry
Step.Description: Call retryProvisionProject method that will retry the plans in the project. Notice we pass in the retryProject which contains only the parts of the main project that need to be retried.

Step.name: Merge Retry Project Results
Step.Description: Merge the results from the retry project back into the project. This step will take and items that are no longer marked rety over to the orginal project.

Step.name: Check for retry
Step.Description: Dig into the project and look for things marked retryable. Build an new plan that contains only the retryable parts.

Step.name: Update Identity Request
Step.Description: Update the Identity Request object with the retry details.

Step.name: Calculate Max Retry
Step.Description:
Calculate the provisioningMaxRetries variable by digging into the retry project in an attempt to resolve the provisioningMaxRetries from the applications that are involved falling back to a system config.
Use the provisioningMaxRetries to drive if we continue to loop or end.

Step.name: Calculate Retry Threshold
Step.Description: Calculate the retryInterval variable by digging into the retry project in an attempt to resolve the provisioningMaxRetries from the applications that are involved falling back to the workflow setting.

Transition.when: script:( ( retryProject != null ) && ( provisioningMaxRetries == -1 || retries < provisioningMaxRetries ) )

Step.name: Check for more provisioning
Step.Description: There may be cases when dependencies that were waiting on a dependency will still have to be fulfulled, for those cases loop back to provisioning.

Step.name: Timeout
Step.Description: Go back through the project and mark everything that was being retried to failure.

Transition.to: Update Identity Request with timeouts failures

Step.name: Update Identity Request with timeouts failures
Step.Description: Update the Identity Request object with the failures that were added to the project due to retry timeout.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: Project that has account requests in the QUEUED state.

Variable.name: provisioningStatusCheckInterval
Variable.Description: The interval in minutes to retry the check status call, defaults to 1 hour.

Variable.name: provisioningMaxStatusChecks
Variable.Description: The maximum number of status checks that will be tried before failure of the provisioning activities. A value of -1 will execute indefinetly, which is the default.

Variable.name: disableIdentityRequests
Variable.Description: May be passed by the calling workflow to disable processing of IdentityRequest objects after provisioning. This option should be passed by any workflow that is not used by LCM and does not maintain the IdentityRequest model. This avoids logging a warning when the IdentityRequest is not found.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this subprocess and when set to true trace statements will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: splitProvisioning
Variable.Description: True to denote this is a partial of the full ProvisioningPlan. This should be true in the case of LCM Provisioning splits.

Variable.name: statusChecks
Variable.Description: The number of status checks performed during the execution of the provisioning activities.

Step.name: Requires Check
Step.Description:
Up front check to compute if the status check is necessary.
Dig into the plan and check to see if any of the plan results have queued items with requestIds??
If both are not true, bail out -- otherwise enter a loop that will checking for status.

Step.name: Initialize Status Checks
Step.Description: When visiting for the first time initalize the statusChecks counter variable and avoid the sleep that we'll want when looping while checking status.

Step.name: Calculate Max Checks
Step.Description: Calculate the maxRetries variable by digging into the retry project in an attempt to resolve the maxRetries from the applications that are involved falling back to a system config.

Step.name: Calculate StatusCheck Threshold
Step.Description: Calculate the provisioningStatusCheckInterval variable by digging into the retry project in an attempt to resolve the maxRetries from the applications that are involved falling back to the workflow setting.

Step.name: Wait for next check
Step.Description: Pause and waiting for things to happen on the PE side. Use the configurable interval to determine how long we wait in between checks.

Step.name: CheckStatus
Step.Description: Call the connector's checkStatus method for each queued item found in a project. This method will also update the status on the plan as items complete.

Step.name: Refresh Identity Request
Step.Description:
Refresh the identity request to include provisioning results returned from the connector's checkStatus any other provisioning side effects updated in the project.
This method gives us the update of each access request item so it can be displayed in the UI as they complete instead of waiting for the entire process to complete.
Note that the disableIdentityRequests input variable is passed to skip request processing if we're being called from a non-LCM workflow. It is easier to pass this option than to transition around this step.

Arg.name: message
Arg.value: Max number of status checks occurred.

Step.name: Apply Committed Results
Step.Description: Apply any of the commited plans, account requests or attribute requests that result from our checking the request status.

Workflow.name: Manage Ticket

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: Project that is being provisioninged.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description: The ID of the IdentityRequest object which can can be used to read/update the external ticket id.

Variable.name: ticketManagementApplication
Variable.Description: Ticketing application that supports creating/updating objects of type ticket.

Variable.name: ticketDataGenerationRule
Variable.Description:
A rule that builds up the ticketing provisioning plan based on the workflow context. This rule gets all of the arguments to this subprocess plus the curreent workflow context. The rule can return either a ProvisioningPlan or a Map of name value pairs.
The rule name can be specified here on the subprocess or on the ticketManagementApplication config under the same name as this variable.

Variable.name: action
Variable.Description:
This is a breadcrumb given to the rule to help it generate the proper provisioning plan for the current injection point. There will be several default injection points that will map to an action.
OOTB There are four points which all workflow are injected and will map to the "actions" passed into this subprocess.
open postApproval postProvisioning close

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this subprocess and when set to true trace statements will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: ticketPlan
Variable.Description: Plan that is generated during the processing of the ticektDataGenerationRule execution. This will eventually be turned in to the ticketProject which can be provisioned.

Variable.name: ticketProject
Variable.Description: Variable that will hold our compiled project, that eventually will be provisioned to the backend ticketing system.

Variable.name: ticketId
Variable.Description: Variable that will hold the ticketId, it may be passed in for update and will be returned on create. If this value is null AND the its not a create action, the ticket id will be read from the identityRequest.externalTicketId field.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: String version of WorkItem.level that will be used to set the priority of any workitems.

Workflow.Description: A workflow subprocss designed to allow service/help desk tickets opened or updated during the lifecycle of a workflow.

Step.name: Generate Ticket Plan
Step.Description: A workflow service that will call to the generation rule to help generate an 'ObjectRequest' based provisioning plan that will be used to create/update the ticket. If the rule returns a plan that plan will be returned directly by the buildTicketPlan call. the rule returns a Map it will be converted into a provisioning plan.

Step.name: Compile Ticket
Step.Description: Compile the generated plan in a project so it can be provisioned. These will normally compile down to a single targeted connector plan.

Step.name: Provision Ticket
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess to initialize the request, this includes auditing, building the approvalset, compiling the plan into project and checking policy violations.

Step.name: Update IdentityRequest External ID
Step.Description: Typically only called once, after the create of the ticket. This call will update the IdentityRequest.externalTicketId with the returned ticketId (String).

Variable.name: doArchive
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable archiving role versions.

Variable.name: doOverlapAnalysis
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable role overlap analysis.

Variable.name: overlapThreshold
Variable.Description: Minimum overlap percentage in any facet a role must have to be included in the result.

Variable.name: approvalObject
Variable.Description: New version of role to approve

Variable.name: approvalType
Variable.Description: Set to "delete" when deleting roles. Set to "rollback" when restoring a role archive. Otherwise null.

Variable.name: approvalSource
Variable.Description: Where in the UI we are requesting the approval. Values: modeler, directed, undirected, certification.

Variable.name: impactAnalysisOwner
Variable.Description: Name of user to receive impact analysis result

Variable.name: roleName
Variable.Description: Role name referenced by the email templates

Variable.name: noRolePropagation
Variable.Description: Set to true to disable role change propagation.

Variable.name: doArchive
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable archiving role versions.

Variable.name: doOverlapAnalysis
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable role overlap analysis.

Variable.name: overlapThreshold
Variable.Description: Minimum overlap percentage in any facet a role must have to be included in the result.

Variable.name: approvalObject
Variable.Description: New version of role to approve

Variable.name: approvalType
Variable.Description: Set to "delete" when deleting roles. Set to "rollback" when restoring an archive. Otherwise null.

Variable.name: approvalSource
Variable.Description: Where in the UI we are requesting the approval. Values: modeler, directed, undirected, certification.

Variable.name: impactAnalysisOwner
Variable.Description: Name of user to receive impact analysis result

Variable.name: roleName
Variable.Description: Role name referenced by the email templates

Variable.name: noRolePropagation
Variable.Description: Set to true to disable role change propagation.

Step.name: start
Step.Description: Copy the role name to a variable for easier reference in the email template. Skip to approvals if there is no impact analysis owner.

Step.name: Impact Analysis
Step.Description: Call a handler method to launch the impact analysis task.

Step.name: Review Analysis
Step.Description: Wait for review of the impact analyis report.

Step.name: Check Approvals
Step.Description: Skip approvals if the launcher is also the (previous) role owner.

Step.name: Approve
Step.Description: Single stage approval by the role owner. The handler method will build a suitable Approval object.

Variable.name: identitizer
Variable.Description: Instance of sailpoint.object.Identitizer that launched this workflow. This is a transient object that will only be used if the workflow executes synchronously to completion when launched. It saves having finishRefresh allocate and initialize a new Identitizer.

Variable.name: identity
Variable.Description: Identity object we're refreshing. This is a transient object that will only be used by finishRefresh if the workflow runs to completion without suspending.

Variable.name: refreshOptions
Variable.Description: Map of options to configure Identitizer when we're ready to complete the refresh. These were culled from the original set of options given to the Identitizer that launched this workflow.

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity object being refreshed. The first half of the refresh will have been committed, this includes link refresh, attribute promotion, and role detction.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: A ProvisioningProject object describing the modifications to the identity. This may include a list of Question objects which will cause the generation of a Form and a WorkItem to solicit additional information necessary for provisioning.

Variable.name: changeEvents
Variable.Description: A list of IdentityChangeEvent objects generated by pre-provisioning triggers.

Variable.name: detectionDifference
Variable.Description: A sailpoint.object.Difference object with changes made to the detected role list during the first half of the refresh. These will already have been committed to the database. In theory this could be used to trigger approvals or notifications though we don't really support the notion of "rejecting" a detection.

Variable.name: previousVersion
Variable.Description: A copy of the Identity object made before the refresh. This is needed in the second phase of refresh for trigger processing.

Variable.name: doManualActions
Variable.Description: When set to 'true' the unmanged plan from the provisioning project will be converted into one or more manual action work items to request the changes since they can't be done automatically. This may be passed in from the refresh task arguments.

Variable.name: enableManualAccountSelection
Variable.Description: When set to 'true' the system will send out Account Selection Notification emails for users with more than one account on any one application and the system can't determine the provisioning account. This may be passed in from the refresh task arguments.

Step.name: Do Provisioning Forms
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess for assembling, presenting, and assimilating provisioning forms.

Step.name: Finish Refresh
Step.Description: Provision what is left in the project then finish the refresh by running policy checks, recalculating scores, and other things.

Step.name: Manual Actions
Step.Description: Present work items for the parts of the project that could not be sent to an integrated IDM system.

Step.name: Save Identity
Step.Description: Present work items for the parts of the project that could not be sent to an integrated IDM system.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this workflow and when set to true trace will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: optimisticProvisioning
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable optimistic provisioning. This will cause changes to the entitlements compiled from role assignments to be applied immediately to the identity cube rather than waiting for the next refresh/reaggregation after the provisioning system completes the request.

Variable.name: foregroundProvisioning
Variable.Description: Normally provisioning is done in a step that uses the "backgroud" option to force the workfow to be suspend and be resumed in a background task thread. This prevents the browser session from hanging since provision can sometimes take a long time. For demos and testing it can be better to do this in the foreground so that provisioning will have been performed when control is returned to the user. This prevents having to run the Perform Maintanance task to see the resutls of the request.

Variable.name: doManualActions
Variable.Description: When set to 'true' the unmanged plan from the provisioning project will be converted into one or more manual action work items to request the changes since they can't be done automatically.

Variable.name: doRefresh
Variable.Description: Set to true to cause an identity refresh after the changes in the plan have been provisioned. This is normally off, you might want this on if you want modification of identity or link attributes to result in an immediate re-evaluation of assigned and detected roles.

Variable.name: requireCreateTemplates
Variable.Description: When set to 'true' any requests for an account that does not exist will be forced into the unmanaged plan unless the target application specifies an account creation template. This may be combined with doManualActions to have work items sent out to handle account creation.

Variable.name: approver
Variable.Description: Name of Identity to approve role assignments. This is not set when launched from the UI, but you may want to hard code an initializer for testing.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: The name of an Identity that will be assigned ownership of any manual action work items if the application owner is not set.

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: Name of Identity that is being updated.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: Master provisioning plan containing the changes to process.

Variable.name: sessionOwner
Variable.Description: This is a system variable that we do not need to declare, but it's good for documentation. This will be set when the workflow is launched to the name of the Identity that is considered to be the owner of the interactive UI session. This is passed to call:buildProvisioningForm so that we present forms to the active user first before suspending and opening work items for other users.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. Query for this using a projection query and fall back to the name.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: Provisioning project containing assigned roles and side effects, compiled from the input plan.

Variable.name: approvalEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for approval notifications.

Step.name: Inspect Plan
Step.Description: Dig some things out of the plan into variables. We're setting newRoles and oldRoles temporarily so we can use the old approval pages. Sould be calculating other differences!

Step.name: Compile Project
Step.Description:
Compile the provisioning plan into a provisioning project. If you need to pass in provisioner options like "noFiltering" or "noRoleDeprovisioning" you must pass them as explicit arguments to the call.
The evaluation options "requester" and "source" are commonly set here.
You can also pass things into the Template and Field scripts by defining Args in this step.

Step.name: Start Approval Process
Step.Description: Add a message to the worflow launch result indicating that an approval is in progress. This also serves an example of building localized messages from the catalog.

Step.name: Do Provisioning Forms
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess for assembling, presenting, and assimilating provisioning forms.

Step.name: Provision
Step.Description: Provision what remains in the project. Normally we won't be here with unanswered provisioning questions, but if we have them the provisioner will just skip creating those accounts and do what it can.

Step.name: Manual Actions
Step.Description: Present work items for the parts of the project that could not be sent to an integrated IDM system.

Step.name: Refresh Identity
Step.Description: Add arguments as necessary to enable refresh features. Typically you only want this to correlate roles and possibly provision if we notice new assigned roles. Note that provisioning will be done in the Identity Refresh workflow so if there are any provisioning forms to display we won't feed them directly to the current user, they'll have to return to the inbox.

Script.Source: //println("Unable to determine owner for provisioning form, terminating process"); //println(wfcontext.getWorkflowCase().toXml());

Workflow.name: Scheduled Assignment

Variable.name: identity
Variable.Description: The database id of the target identity

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the target identity

Variable.name: assigner
Variable.Description: The name of the identity considered to be the source of the assignment. This is used for the audit event. It is not necessary to make the assignment becuase the original assigner will also be stored in RoleAssignment metadata in the cube.

Variable.name: doRefresh
Variable.Description: Set to true to cause a cube refresh after the assignment

Variable.name: eventType
Variable.Description: The type of assignment. This will be one of the constants defined in RoleEventGenerator.

Variable.name: role
Variable.Description: The database id of the role to assign, if this is a role event

Variable.name: roleName
Variable.Description: The name of the role to assign, if this is a role event

Variable.name: assignmentId
Variable.Description: The unique id of the RoleAssignment, if this is a role event

Variable.name: application
Variable.Description: The database id of an application, if this is an entitlement event

Variable.name: applicationName
Variable.Description: The name of an application, if this is an entitlement event

Variable.name: instance
Variable.Description: The name of an application instance, if this is an entitlement event

Variable.name: nativeIdentity
Variable.Description: The specific id of the target account in the application, if this is an entitlement event

Variable.name: name
Variable.Description: The name of an attribute in the account schema, if this is an entitlement event

Variable.name: value
Variable.Description: The value of the account attribute, if this is an entitlement event

Variable.name: enableRetryRequest
Variable.Description: When set to true it will disable the workflow retry loop and let the Provision step launch requests to handle the retries. Enabling this flag will enable some older functionality.

Variable.name: enableManualAccountSelection
Variable.Description: When set to 'true' the system will send out Account Selection Notification emails for users with more than one account on any one application and the system can't determine the provisioning account. This may be passed in from the refresh task arguments.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: ProvisioningProject compiled from the Request

Variable.name: doManualActions
Variable.Description: When set to 'true' the unmanged plan from the provisioning project will be converted into one or more manual action work items to request the changes since they can't be done automatically. This may be passed in from the refresh task arguments.

Workflow.Description: Workflow called to handle a scheduled assignment and deassignments, commonly known as "sunrise" and "sunset". These are intended to be used only from Request objects that are scheduled by the provisioning plan evaluator.

Script.Source: // hooks for project customization before execution

Step.name: Do Provisioning Forms
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess for assembling, presenting, and assimilating provisioning forms.

Step.name: Provision
Step.Description: Execute the scheduled assignment project. We call the standard subprocess that handles retries. Note that the disableIdentityRequests option is passed to prevent logging a warning since this workflow does not maintain IdentityRequest objects.

Step.name: Refresh Identity
Step.Description: Add arguments as necessary to enable refresh features. Provisioning is usually done with an option to the Activate Assignment step. Here you might want to check policies or refresh the scorecard. Correlating entitlements might pick up new detected roles if the provisioning was done synchronously.

Step.name: Manual Actions
Step.Description: Present work items for the parts of the project that could not be sent to an integrated IDM system.

Workflow.name: Scheduled Role Activation

Variable.name: eventType
Variable.Description: The type of the role activation event. This will be one of the constants defined in RoleEventGenerator: roleActivation or roleDeactivation

Variable.name: role
Variable.Description: The database id of the role we're changing.

Variable.name: roleName
Variable.Description: The name of the role we're changing.

Variable.name: doRefresh
Variable.Description: Set to true to cause a full identity refresh after activation.

Variable.name: noRolePropagation
Variable.Description: Set to true to disable role change propagation.

Workflow.Description: Workflow called when a role is ready to be enabled or disabled.

Variable.name: optimisticProvisioning
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable optimistic provisioning. This will cause changes to the entitlements compiled from role assignments to be applied immediately to the identity cube rather than waiting for the next refresh/reaggregation after the provisioning system completes the request.

Variable.name: foregroundProvisioning
Variable.Description: Normally provisioning is done in a step that uses the "backgroud" option to force the workfow to be suspend and be resumed in a background task thread. This prevents the browser session from hanging since provision can sometimes take a long time. For demos and testing it can be better to do this in the foreground so that provisioning will have been performed when control is returned to the user. This prevents having to run the Perform Maintanance task to see the resutls of the request. For group requests this is much less of a problem than it is for account provisioning.

Variable.name: doManualActions
Variable.Description: When set to 'true' the unmanged plan from the provisioning project will be converted into one or more manual action work items to request the changes since they can't be done automatically.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: The name of an Identity that will be assigned ownership of any manual action work items if the application owner is not set.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: Master provisioning plan containing the changes to process.

Variable.name: approver
Variable.Description: Name of Identity to approve entitlement changes. This is not set when launched from the UI, but you may want to hard code an initializer for testing.

Variable.name: sessionOwner
Variable.Description: This is a system variable that we do not need to declare, but it's good for documentation. This will be set when the workflow is launched to the name of the Identity that is considered to be the owner of the interactive UI session. This is passed to call:buildProvisioningForm so that we present forms to the active user first before suspending and opening work items for other users.

Variable.name: summaryName
Variable.Description: Single string representation of ManagedAttribute identity. This must be at least a combination of the application name and the managed attribute value (group name).

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: Provisioning project containing assigned roles and side effects, compiled from the input plan.

Variable.name: changes
Variable.Description: A ChangeSummary object containing a JSF friendly summary of the changes being made.

Step.name: Examine Plan
Step.Description: Derive a single string we can use as the name of the entitlement in approvals and logging.

Step.name: Compile Project
Step.Description: Compile the provisioning plan into a provisioning project. Unlike the project compilation step for identities, we do not expect to be dealing with provisioning policies and forms.

Step.name: Start Approval Process
Step.Description: Add a message to the worflow launch result indicating that an approval is in progress. This also serves an example of building localized messages from the catalog.

Step.name: Start Provisioning Process
Step.Description: Leave a launch message that can be displayed in the browser before we start provisioning which may be asynchronous. Note that this uses the same message catalog keys as the identity update workflows which is okay because they don't mention the type of object being processed. If that changes we'll need our own set of keys.

Step.name: Provision
Step.Description: Provision what remains in the project. Normally we won't be here with unanswered provisioning questions.

Step.name: Check Provisioning Errors
Step.Description: Placeholder for custom logging or other actions. If there were group provisioning errors, provisionGroupProject will have left them in the WorkflowCase.messages list.

Variable.name: syncAll
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable full synchronization over all accounts.

Variable.name: targetApplications
Variable.Description: Set to a csv or List(String) of Application names that will be synchronized.

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: Name of the Identity whose password has changed.

Variable.name: applicationName
Variable.Description: Name of the Application where the password change was detected.

Variable.name: nativeIdentity
Variable.Description: Name of the account on the Application where the password change was detected.

Variable.name: password
Variable.Description: The new password, encrypted.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: A ProvisionignProject compiled from the target list.

Step.name: Compile Project
Step.Description: Perform the default password synchronization using the supplied application list.

Step.name: Examine Project
Step.Description: This is a placeholder for custom code that may want to alter the project before execution.

Script.Source: //System.out.println("Password intercept project:"); //System.out.println(project.toXml());

Step.name: Provision
Step.Description: Execute the password synchronization project. We call the standard subprocess that handles retries. Note that the disableIdentityRequests option is passed to prevent logging a warning since this workflow does not maintain IdentityRequest objects.

Step.name: Audit
Step.Description: Placeholder, what kind of auditing should we do? We've got low level ProvisioningResults in the project.

Step.name: Empty Project
Step.Description: Here if there wasn't enough to build a project. If there were missing inputs there should be errors in the log. We could just be here because there were no sync targets.

Script.Source: //System.out.println("Empty synchronization project");

Workflow.name: Alert - Disable Account

Variable.name: alertDefinition
Variable.Description: The alertDefinition object that matched the alert.

Variable.name: alertId
Variable.Description: The id of the Alert that triggered the workflow.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: ProvisioningPlan generated for the Alert.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: The compiled project from the plan

Variable.name: op
Variable.Description: Operation to take.

Workflow.Description:
Disable accounts when alert is triggered.
If the alert's targetType is Identity, this will set the Identity inactive.
If the alert's targetType is Link, this will disable the account associated to the link.

Step.name: Build Provisioning Plan
Step.Description: Build the Provisioning plan to disable the correct account

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity we're supposed to update.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. Query for this using a projection query and fall back to the name.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: The provisioning plan ready to execute.

Variable.name: flow
Variable.Description:
The name of the LCM flow that launched this workflow.
This is one of these two values:
IdentityCreateRequest IdentityEditRequest

Variable.name: optimisticProvisioning
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable optimistic provisioning. This will cause changes to the entitlements compiled from role assignments to be applied immediately to the identity cube rather than waiting for the next refresh/reaggregation after the provisioning system completes the request.

Variable.name: foregroundProvisioning
Variable.Description: Normally provisioning is done in a step that uses the "backgroud" option to force the workfow to be suspend and be resumed in a background task thread. This prevents the browser session from hanging since provision can sometimes take a long time. For demos and testing it can be better to do this in the foreground so that provisioning will have been performed when control is returned to the user. This prevents having to run the Perform Maintanance task to see the resutls of the request.

Variable.name: notificationScheme
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies who should be notified when the request has been complete. The value can be null or a csv of one or more of the following options.
none or null disable notifications
user Identity that is being update will be notified.
manager The manager of the Identity that is being updated will be notified.
requester The person that has requested the update will be notified.

Variable.name: approvalMode
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies how we should handle the approvals.
By default this is serial since most of these request with the exception of manager transfers will have only one approver.
parallel Approvals are processed concurrently and there must be consensus, we wait for all approvers to approve. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
parallelPoll Approvals are processed concurrently but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections.
serial Approvals are processed one at a time and there must be consensus. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
serialPoll Approvals are processed in order but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections. In effect we are "taking a poll" of the approvers.
any Approvals are processed concurrently, the first approver to respond makes the decision for the group.

Variable.name: approvalScheme
Variable.Description:
A String that specifies how approvals should be generated for this workflow there are five built-in modes
none - disabled approvals
manager - The user's current manager will get approvals
newManager - The newly assigned manager will get approvals when manager transfers occur. Otherwise the user's manager current manager will be the approver.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: A String that specifies the name of the Identity that will be assigned any approvals where the owner of the approver can't be resolved. Example if the scheme is "owner" and the application doesn't specify and owner.

Variable.name: policyScheme
Variable.Description:
A String that specifies how policy checks effect the overall process.
none - disabled policy checking
fail - fail and exit the workflow if any policy violations are found
continue - continue if policy violations are found

Variable.name: policiesToCheck
Variable.Description: A List of policies that should be checked. If this list is empty all violations will be checked. Used in combination with policyScheme.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description:
This attributes is set during the "Build Approval Set" step, which builds this list by going through the ProvisioningPlan to build the line items that need to be approved,
This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this workflow and when set to true trace will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: ProvisioningProject which is just a compiled version of the ProvisioningPlan.

Variable.name: policyViolations
Variable.Description: List of policy violations that were found during our initial policy scan. This list is passed into each work item so the approvers can see pending violations.

Variable.name: approvalForm
Variable.Description: The form that is generated based on the changes that were made. This form will be sent into the workitem and allow editing of the requested values during the approval process. This is generated in "Build Approval Form" based on the passed-in plan.

Variable.name: interface
Variable.Description: This variable shows up in Audit logs.

Step.name: Build Approval Set
Step.Description:
The rule will go through the plan and build an approvalItem for each AccountRequest, typically there is just one for the IIQ application requests.
The rule will also annotate the plan with the previousValues so that they can be assimilated onto the Form that is build, which is used during the approval process for edits.

Step.name: Customize Approval Form
Step.Description: using the form that was generaed, mMrk the password field read only so approvers can't change it. Also associate a Rule with the name so name changes during approvals can be validate.

Step.name: Assimilate Form Changes
Step.Description: This step takes the form from the workitem and applys any edits that were made back into the plan.

Step.name: Compile Project
Step.Description:
Compile the provisioning plan into a provisioning project. If you need to pass in provisioner options like "noFiltering" or "noRoleDeprovisioning" you must pass them as explicit arguments to the call.
The evaluation options "requester" and "source" are commonly set here.
You can also pass things into the Template and Field scripts by defining Args in this step.

Step.name: Provision
Step.Description: Provision what remains in the project. Normally we won't be here with unanswered provisioning questions, but if we have them the provisioner will just skip creating those accounts and do what it can.

Step.name: Post Provision
Step.Description: Mark all of the items in the approvalset provisioned since these are all synchronous activities.

Step.name: Check Plan and Update Cart
Step.Description: This step takes looks for name changes during creates and updates the stub identity on the plan accordingly.

Workflow.name: Provisioning Approval Subprocess

Variable.name: approvalMode
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies how we should handle the approvals.
By default this is serial since most of these request with the exception of manager transfers will have only one approver.
parallel Approvals are processed concurrently and there must be consensus, we wait for all approvers to approve. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
parallelPoll Approvals are processed concurrently but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections.
serial Approvals are processed one at a time and there must be consensus. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
serialPoll Approvals are processed in order but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections. In effect we are "taking a poll" of the approvers.
any Approvals are processed concurrently, the first approver to respond makes the decision for the group.

Variable.name: approvalScheme
Variable.Description:
A csv string that specifies how approval items should be generated for the incoming request.
The value can be "none", in which case approvals are disabled.
The value can also be a combination of any of the values below in any order, separated by commas. The order in which they are specified is the order in which they are processed:
owner The object owner gets the approval item. For Role approvals this is the Role object owner. For Entitlement approvals this is the Entitlement object owner.
manager The manager gets the approval item.
securityOfficer The identity in the variable securityOfficerName gets the approval item.
identity The identities/workgroups in the variable approvingIdentities get the approval item.

Variable.name: approvingIdentities
Variable.Description: List of identities and/or workgroups names/ids that should be involved in the approval process.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: A String that specifies the name of the Identity that will be assigned any approvals where the owner of the approver can't be resolved. Example if the scheme is "owner" and the application doesn't specify and owner.

Variable.name: flow
Variable.Description:
The name of the LCM flow that launched this workflow.
This is one of these values:
AccountsRequest EntitlementsRequest RolesRequest IdentityCreateRequest IdentityEditRequest ForgotPassword ExpiredPassword PasswordRequest

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity being updated.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. Query for this using a projection query and fall back to the name.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description: The ID of the IdentityRequest for this request.

Variable.name: policyViolations
Variable.Description: List of policy violations that were found during our initial policy scan. This list is passed into each work item so the approvers can see pending violations.

Variable.name: managerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by a manager.

Variable.name: ownerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by object owners.

Variable.name: securityOfficerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by the security officer.

Variable.name: identityElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by object owners.

Variable.name: managerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when manager of pending approvals.

Variable.name: ownerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the owner of pending approvals.

Variable.name: securityOfficerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the security officer of pending approvals.

Variable.name: identityEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the security officer of pending approvals.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this workflow and when set to true trace will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: workItemDescription
Variable.Description: String "template" that will be used as the workitem description.

Variable.name: workItemEscalationTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template that should be used when sending out reminders.

Variable.name: workItemHoursBetweenReminders
Variable.Description: The number of hours to wait between sending reminders to approvers.

Variable.name: workItemHoursTillEscalation
Variable.Description: The number of hourse to wait until an approval should be escalated.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: The String version of a WorkItem.Priority. This variable is used to set the priority on all of the workitems generated as part of this workflow and also set on the IdentityRequest object.

Variable.name: workItemReminderTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template that should be used when sending out reminders.

Variable.name: workItemEscalationRule
Variable.Description: The rule used to assign a new ownder during escalation.

Variable.name: workItemMaxReminders
Variable.Description: The maximum number of reminder emails that will be sent before we begin the escalation process.

Variable.name: filterRejects
Variable.Description: True to filter rejected items when running in Serial/SerialPoll mode.

Variable.name: setPreviousApprovalDecisions
Variable.Description: True to pre-populate approval decisions from previous approvals.

Variable.name: clearApprovalDecisions
Variable.Description: True to clear all decisions when generating approvals

Variable.name: dontUpdatePlan
Variable.Description: True to skip updating the ProvisioningProject masterPlan when processing approval decisions.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description: ApprovalSet representing the things that were requested and come from the master provisioning plan.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: ProvisioningProject which is just a compiled version of the ProvisioningPlan, the master plan will be adjusted when approval decisions are applied and a new revised provisiobion project will be returned.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: The provisioning plan.

Workflow.Description: Simple approval subrocess introduced into release 6.2 to make adding custom approvals easier. This approval subprocess has a configuration form to make it easier to configure from the Business Process Editor.

Step.name: Account Approval
Step.Description: Step library that can be used for provisioning request approvals. The process assumes many of the Provisioning Workflow structures exist and has things like provisioning plans and approvalSets are required.

Step.name: Notify
Step.Description: Notify the various actors specified on notification scheme.

Workflow.name: Identity Request Violation Review

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: The name of the identity object being modified.

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity object being modified.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. This may be passed in, if not the script queries for this using a projection query and falls back to the name.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: The provisioning plan ready to execute.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: The provisioning plan ready to execute.

Variable.name: optimisticProvisioning
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable optimistic provisioning. This will cause changes to the entitlements compiled from role assignments to be applied immediately to the identity cube rather than waiting for the next refresh/reaggregation after the provisioning system completes the request.

Variable.name: enableRetryRequest
Variable.Description: When set to true it will disable the workflow retry loop and let the Provision step launch requests to handle the retries. Enabling this flag will enable some older functionality.

Variable.name: policyViolations
Variable.Description: List of policy violations that were found during our initial policy scan. This list is passed into each work item so the approvers can see pending violations.

Variable.name: policiesToCheck
Variable.Description: A List of policies that should be checked. If this list is empty all violations will be checked. Used in combination with policyScheme.

Variable.name: asyncCacheRefresh
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable asynchronous refresh of the policy and role caches. This speeds up response time for the LCM user, but you may want to disable this during demonstrations after editing the role or policy models. This may also be enabled globally in the system configuration. This variable overrides the system configuration if it has a value.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
