Variable.Description: String version of WorkItem.level that will be used to set the priority of the IdentityRequest.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description: This attribute is passed in and contains the current set of approvalItems in the request. When a user chooses to remove a problematic approval item from the request, we update this value before returning to the calling workflow.

Variable.name: flow
Variable.Description:
The name of the LCM flow that launched this workflow.
This is one of these values:
AccountsRequest EntitlementsRequest RolesRequest IdentityCreateRequest IdentityEditRequest ForgotPassword ExpiredPassword PasswordRequest

Variable.name: allowRequestsWithViolations
Variable.Description: If this variable is set to true, requesters will be able to proceed past the Policy Violation Review form without taking any action on policy violations resulting from the request.

Variable.name: requireViolationReviewComments
Variable.Description: If true, requesters will be required to enter in comments if they proceed with a request that will result in policy violations.

Variable.name: violationReviewDecision
Variable.Description:
Decision made by the user in the Policy Violation Review step. This may be one of three choices:
-ignore: User is ignoring the violations and letting the request continue. If requireViolationReviewComments=true the user will be required to enter comments indicating why they are allowing the violations.
-remediate: Indicates that the user removed the request items that were causing the violations
-cancel: Indicates that the user decided to abandon the request, terminating the workflow.

Variable.name: workItemComments
Variable.Description: Completion comments added if the user decides to proceed with the request without addressing the policy violations. These comments will be propagated to all other approvals.

Variable.name: originalPlan
Variable.Description: The original plan calculated for the request. As request modifications are submitted and resubmitted after violation review, we will revert to the original plan, so that the new selections can be calculated starting from a clean slate.

Workflow.Description: This sub-process determines if there are any violations which will be caused by the request specified in the plan. If the policy scheme is 'interactive' the user will be presented with a form which details the actions they can take to deal with the violations. Otherwise, control is returned to the calling process.

Step.name: Save Original Plan
Step.Description: When a policyScheme of "interactive" is set, the user has an opportunity to resolve the violation by removing requests. Multiple iterations of this form may be submitted. Each submission must reset the plan so that when the plan is compiled anew with the new set of decisions, the original master plan is utilized. This step saves that master plan. It is reloaded in the "Reset Original Plan" step.

Step.name: Reset Original Plan
Step.Description: In this step, we need to reload the original plan because previous decisions may have modified the plan, so start with the original complete plan. Also see the step "Save Original Plan".

Step.name: Violation Review

Arg.name: workItemDescription
Arg.value: Policy Violation Review - Account Changes for User: $(identityDisplayName)

Step.Description: Give the user the option of either removing problematic request items, or affirm that they are aware of the violations and wish to continue.

Step.name: Process Violation Review Decisions
Step.Description: Process the decisions made by the user. This will update the plan by removing any items that were rejected by the user.

Step.name: Compile Project
Step.Description: Recompile the provisioning plan into a provisioning project, taking into consideration any items removed on the violation review form.

Workflow.name: Identity Request Initialize

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity object being modified.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. This may be passed in, if not the script queries for this using a projection query and falls back to the name.

Variable.name: endOnManualWorkItems
Variable.Description: Option to skip requests with manual work items.

Variable.name: endOnProvisioningForms
Variable.Description: Option to skip requests with provisioning forms.

Variable.name: flow
Variable.Description:
The name of the LCM flow that launched this workflow.
This is one of these values:
AccountsRequest EntitlementsRequest RolesRequest IdentityCreateRequest IdentityEditRequest ForgotPassword ExpiredPassword PasswordRequest

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: The provisioning plan ready to execute.

Variable.name: optimisticProvisioning
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable optimistic provisioning. This will cause changes to the entitlements compiled from role assignments to be applied immediately to the identity cube rather than waiting for the next refresh/reaggregation after the provisioning system completes the request.

Variable.name: asyncCacheRefresh
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable asynchronous refresh of the policy and role caches. This speeds up response time for the LCM user, but you may want to disable this during demonstrations after editing the role or policy models. This may also be enabled globally in the system configuration. This variable overrides the system configuration if it has a value.

Variable.name: policiesToCheck
Variable.Description: A List of policies that should be checked. If this list is empty all violations will be checked. Used in combination with policyScheme.

Variable.name: allowRequestsWithViolations
Variable.Description: If this variable is set to true, requesters will be able to proceed past the Policy Violation Review form without taking any action on policy violations resulting from the request.

Variable.name: requireViolationReviewComments
Variable.Description: If true, requesters will be required to enter in comments if they proceed with a request that will result in policy violations.

Variable.name: formTemplate
Variable.Description: Template used when processing provisioning forms.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this subprocess and when set to true trace statements will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: policyScheme
Variable.Description:
A String that specifies how policy checks effect the overall process.
none - disabled policy checking
interactive - allow requester to remove request items which are causing violations
continue - continue if policy violations are found
fail - fail and exit the workflow if any policy violations are found

Variable.name: source
Variable.Description: String version of sailpoint.object.Source to indicate where the request originated. Defaults to LCM.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: String version of WorkItem.level that will be used to set the priority any generated workitems. It will also configure the priority of the request as on the generated Access Request.

Variable.name: enableRetryRequest
Variable.Description: When set to true it will disable the workflow retry loop and let the Provision step launch requests to handle the retries. Enabling this flag will enable some older functionality.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: A ProvisioningProject object describing the modifications to the identity. This may include a list of Question objects which will cause the generation of a Form and a WorkItem to solicit additional information necessary for provisioning.

Variable.name: policyViolations
Variable.Description: List of policy violations that were found during our initial policy scan. This list is passed into each work item so the approvers can see pending violations.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description:
This attribute is set during the "Build Approval Set" step, which builds this list by going through the ProvisioningPlan to build the line items that need to be approved.
This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: identityRequest
Variable.Description: The request object we get back from the create call. This is primarily useful for debugging.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description: The id of the IdentityRequest created.

Variable.name: violationReviewDecision
Variable.Description:
Decision made by the user in the Policy Violation Review step. This may be one of three choices:
-ignore: User is ignoring the violations and letting the request continue. If requireViolationReviewComments=true the user will be required to enter comments indicating why they are allowing the violations.
-remediate: Indicates that the user removed the request items that were causing the violations
-cancel: Indicates that the user decided to abandon the request, terminating the workflow.

Variable.name: enableApprovalRecommendations
Variable.Description: Flag to determine if recommendations should be gathered for the approvals.

Variable.name: workItemComments
Variable.Description: Global comments accumulated during the workflow which should be shared with other approvals. When a new approval is created, the comments in this list will be added to the work item.

Workflow.Description:
This workflow subprocess is used to initialize the various object necessary when executing workflows that deal with provisioning.
This subprocess was added in 5.5 in an effort to break groups of related steps into a single call from the top level workflow.
It now encapsulates the following services:
- Compliation of the plan into a project - Build an approval set defaults to using buildApprovalSet but allows it to be passed in - Audit Start - Create the IdentityRequest object for the request tracking - Check policies - Build required forms for the launcher

Step.name: Compile Project
Step.Description:
Compile the provisioning plan into a provisioning project. If you need to pass in provisioner options like "noFiltering" or "noRoleDeprovisioning" you must pass them as explicit arguments to the call.
The evaluation options "requester" and "source" are commonly set here.
You can also pass things into the Template and Field scripts by defining Args in this step.

Step.name: Do Provisioning Forms Pre-Approval
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess for assembling, presenting, and assimilating provisioning forms that can be filled out before approvals.

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity object being modified.

Variable.name: batchRequestId
Variable.Description: Batch request id.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. This may be passed in, if not the script queries for this using a projection query and falls back to the name.

Variable.name: identityId
Variable.Description: The id of the identity being updated.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description: The ID of the IdentityRequest for this request.

Variable.name: approvalScheme
Variable.Description:
A csv string that specifies how approvals should be generated for the incoming request.
The value can be any of the values below, combined together but are always processed in this order:
1. manager 2. owner 3. securityOfficer
Any rejected items from previous approvals will be omitted from the next phase of approvers.
none - disabled approvals
owner - the object owner gets the approval For Role approvals this is the Role object owner. When dealing with things like Unlock and other account level changes the approvals will be assigned to the the application owner.
manager - The manager will get all approvals
securityOfficer - The identity named security the security in the variable securityOfficerName.

Variable.name: approvalMode
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies how we should handle the approvals.
By default this is serial since most of these request with the exception of manager transfers will have only one approver.
parallel Approvals are processed concurrently and there must be consensus, we wait for all approvers to approve. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
parallelPoll Approvals are processed concurrently but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections.
serial Approvals are processed one at a time and there must be consensus. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
serialPoll Approvals are processed in order but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections. In effect we are "taking a poll" of the approvers.
any Approvals are processed concurrently, the first approver to respond makes the decision for the group.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: A String that specifies the name of the Identity that will be assigned any approvals where the owner of the approver can't be resolved. Example if the scheme is "owner" and the application doesn't specify and owner.

Variable.name: securityOfficerName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity that will be sent approvals during security officer approvals.

Variable.name: batchRequestApprover
Variable.Description: Identity responsible for approving batch requests.

Variable.name: includeRejectedItemsInApprovalChain
Variable.Description: When using multi approvalSchemes a flag to indicate if new approvals in the chain will include rejected items.

Variable.name: policyViolations
Variable.Description: List of policy violations that were found during our initial policy scan. This list is passed into each work item so the approvers can see pending violations.

Variable.name: flow
Variable.Description:
The name of the LCM flow that launched this workflow.
This is one of these values:
AccountsRequest EntitlementsRequest RolesRequest IdentityCreateRequest IdentityEditRequest ForgotPassword ExpiredPassword PasswordRequest

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this subprocess and when set to true trace statements will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description:
This attributes is set during the "Build Approval Set" step, which builds this list by going through the ProvisioningPlan to build the line items that need to be approved,
This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: managerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when manager of pending approvals.

Variable.name: ownerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the owner of pending approvals.

Variable.name: securityOfficerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the security officer of pending approvals.

Variable.name: batchApproverEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the batch approver of pending approval.

Variable.name: workItemComments
Variable.Description: List of global workflow comments to be appended to the approval workitem.

Variable.name: managerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by a manager.

Variable.name: ownerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by object owners.

Variable.name: securityOfficerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by the security officer.

Variable.name: batchApproverElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by the batch approver when performing batch operations.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: String version of WorkItem.level that will be used to set the priority of the workitems generated as part of any generated approvals.

Variable.name: tmpApprovalSet
Variable.Description: Temporary and transient ApprovalSet used to hold filtered approval sets as we transition through the approval chain.

Variable.name: tmpApproval
Variable.Description: Temporary and transient list of Approval object used to hold filtered approval as we transition through the approval chain.

Step.name: Manager Approval

Arg.name: workItemDescription
Arg.value: Manager Approval - Account Changes for User: $(identityDisplayName)

Step.Description: If approvalScheme contains manager, send an approval for all requested items in the request. This approval will get the entire approvalSet as part of the workitem.

Step.name: Owner Approval

Arg.name: workItemDescription
Arg.value: Owner Approval - Account Changes for User: $(identityDisplayName)

Step.Description:
If approvalScheme contains owner, send approvals out to all of the owners for items in the request. The main approvalSet is broken up into owner specific approval sets and assimilated back into the main approvalset as decisions are made.
The previous decisions made on the items will be present along with any comments made by the manager.
This step will be skipped if all items are rejected and includeRejectedItemsInApprovalChain is set to false

Step.name: Security Officer Approval

Arg.name: workItemDescription
Arg.value: Security Officer Approval - Account Changes for User: $(identityDisplayName)

Step.Description:
If approvalScheme contains securityOfficer and the securityOfficeName is non null this step will send items with decisions and comments from the cart for final decision.
The previous decisions made on the item will be present along with any comments made in previous approval steps.

Step.name: Batch Request Approval
Step.Description: If approvalScheme contains batchRequest and the batchRequestApprover is non null this step will send items with decisions and comments from the cart for final decision.

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity object being modified.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. This may be passed in, if not the script queries for this using a projection query and falls back to the name.

Variable.name: notificationScheme
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies who should be notified when the request has been complete. The value can be null or a csv of one or more of the following options.
none or null disable notifications
user Identity that is being update will be notified.
manager The manager of the Identity that is being updated will be notified.
requester The person that has requested the update will be notified.
securityOfficer The identity named in the securityOfficerNameVariable will be notified.

Variable.name: securityOfficerName
Variable.Description: The name of the security officer identity.

Variable.name: policyViolations
Variable.Description: List of policy violations that were found during our initial policy scan. This list is passed into each work item so the approvers can see pending violations.

Variable.name: flow
Variable.Description:
The name of the LCM flow that launched this workflow.
This is one of these values:
AccountsRequest EntitlementsRequest RolesRequest IdentityCreateRequest IdentityEditRequest ForgotPassword ExpiredPassword PasswordRequest

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this subprocess and when set to true trace statements will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: approvalScheme
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies how approvals should be generated for this workflow.
This is usefull for the notification subprocess incase the template wants to render specific text in the email when certain schemes are configured.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description:
This attributes is set during the "Build Approval Set" step, which builds this list by going through the ProvisioningPlan to build the line items that need to be approved,
This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: The provisioning plan for the request.

Variable.name: userEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the user.

Variable.name: managerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the manager.

Variable.name: requesterEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the requester.

Variable.name: securityOfficerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the security officer.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: String version of WorkItem.level that was used to set the priority on the access request and any workitems.

Workflow.name: Identity Request Provision

Variable.name: optimisticProvisioning
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable optimistic provisioning. This will cause changes to the entitlements compiled from role assignments to be applied immediately to the identity cube rather than waiting for the next refresh/reaggregation after the provisioning system completes the request.

Variable.name: foregroundProvisioning
Variable.Description: Normally provisioning is done in a step that uses the "background" option to force the workflow to be suspend and be resumed in a background task thread. This prevents the browser session from hanging since provision can sometimes take a long time. For demos and testing it can be better to do this in the foreground so that provisioning will have been performed when control is returned to the user. This prevents having to run the Perform Maintenance task to see the resutls of the request.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: A String that specifies the name of the Identity that will be assigned any manual actions where the owner of the approver can't be resolved.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description:
This attributes is set during the "Build Approval Set" step, which builds this list by going through the ProvisioningPlan to build the line items that need to be approved,
This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: formTemplate
Variable.Description: Template used when processing provisioning forms.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this workflow and when set to true trace will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: The plan may be passed in from the Create/Update Identity workflows. Otherwise the passed in project's master plan is typically used.

Variable.name: recompile
Variable.Description: Option that can be used to prevent recompilation after approval changes have been applied to the plan/project.

Variable.name: manualActionsEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Option that can be used to prevent recompilation after approval changes have been applied to the plan/project.

Variable.name: workItemComments
Variable.Description: Global comments which should be appended to each approval item.

Variable.name: approvalScheme
Variable.Description:
A csv string that specifies how approvals should be generated for the incoming request.
The value can be any of the values below, combined together but are always processed in this order:
1. manager 2. owner 3. securityOfficer
Any rejected items from previous approvals will be omitted from the next phase of approvers.
none - disabled approvals
owner - the object owner gets the approval For Role approvals this is the Role object owner. When dealing with things like Unlock and other account level changes the approvals will be assigned to the the application owner.
manager - The manager will get all approvals
securityOfficer - The identity named security the security in the variable securityOfficerName.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description: The ID of the IdentityRequest.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: String version of WorkItem.level that will be used to set the priority on any generated workitems for of forms or manual actions.

Variable.name: splitProvisioning
Variable.Description: True to denote this is a partial of the full ProvisioningPlan. This should be true in the case of LCM Provisioning splits.

Variable.name: saveUnmanagedPlan
Variable.Description: When true we will save unmanaged plan as ProvisioningRequest.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: ProvisioningProject which is just a compiled version of the ProvisioningPlan.

Workflow.Description:
This workflow subprocess is used to provision a project.
This subprocess was added in 5.5 in an effort to break groups of related steps into a single call from the top level workflow.
It now encapsulates the following services:
- Process approval decisions -- which recompiles the project - Post provisioning forms for user's outside of the requester

Step.name: Process Approval Decisions
Step.Description: Dig through the ApprovalSets found in the Approval step and build an audit trail for the decisions. Then for any rejected items remove them from the provisioning plan so they are not part of the provisioning request.

Step.name: Do Provisioning Forms Post-Approval
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess for assembling, presenting, and assimilating provisioning forms that remain after approvals.

Step.name: Pre Provision
Step.Description: Before we approve assimilate the result of any accountId changes that may have been compiled into the plan back onto the ApprovalSet.

Step.name: Refresh Identity Request
Step.Description: Assimilate any approval summaries that were built up during the provisioning process.

Step.name: Provision
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess to initialize the request, this includes auditing, building the approvalset, compiling the plan into project and checking policy violations.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: ProvisioningProject which is just a compiled version of the ProvisioningPlan. From the project the IdentityRequestItem model will be updated.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description:
The ID ot the identitytRequestId.
This step will update the identityRequest status and completion status.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description:
This attributes is set during the "Build Approval Set" step, which builds this list by going through the ProvisioningPlan to build the line items that need to be approved,
This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this subprocess and when set to true trace statements will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: ticketManagementApplication
Variable.Description: Name of the application that can handle ticket requests. When non-null the Manage Ticket Steps will be visited to open tickets during the workflow lifecycle.

Variable.name: ticketDataGenerationRule
Variable.Description:
A rule that builds up the ticketing provisioning plan based on the workflow context. This rule gets all of the arguments to this subprocess plus the curreent workflow context. The rule can return either a ProvisioningPlan or a Map of name value pairs.
The rule name can be specified here on the subprocess or on the ticketManagementApplication config under the same name as this variable.

Variable.name: autoVerifyIdentityRequest
Variable.Description: Flag to indicate when finishing the request we should automatically mark it verified. Currently used by the change password workflow so we don't wait to verify since passwords can't be verifed.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: String version of WorkItem.level that was used to set the priority of the IdentityRequest and workitems.

Step.name: Update Ticket On Complete
Step.Description:
Call a subprocess to update the ticket in the ticketManagementApplication is non-null.
You can specify a specific 'ticketDataGenerationRule' here or you can also specify it on the application. It'll be read from the argument first and fall back to the ' application config.

Workflow.name: Identity Request Approve Identity Changes

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity object being modified.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. This may be passed in, if not the script queries for this using a projection query and falls back to the name.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description: The ID of the IdentityRequest.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: The provisioning plan ready to execute.

Variable.name: formTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the form Template to use when building provisioning form.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description: This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: approvers
Variable.Description: Owners that should recieve the approval.

Variable.name: approvalScheme
Variable.Description:
A String that specifies how approvals should be generated for this workflow there are five built-in modes
none - disabled approvals
manager - The user's current manager will get approvals
newManager - The newly assigned manager will get approvals when manager transfers occur. Otherwise the user's manager current manager will be the approver.
securityOfficer - The identity in the securityOfficerName variable will get approvals.

Variable.name: approvalEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for approval notifications.

Variable.name: securityOfficerName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity that will be sent approvals during security officer approvals.

Variable.name: approvalForm
Variable.Description: The generated form that is displayed to the user during the approval.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: A String that specifies the name of the Identity that will be assigned any manual actions where the owner of the approver can't be resolved.

Variable.name: approvalMode
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies how we should handle the approvals.
By default this is serial since most of these request with the exception of manager transfers will have only one approver.
parallel Approvals are processed concurrently and there must be consensus, we wait for all approvers to approve. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
parallelPoll Approvals are processed concurrently but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections.
serial Approvals are processed one at a time and there must be consensus. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
serialPoll Approvals are processed in order but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections. In effect we are "taking a poll" of the approvers.
any Approvals are processed concurrently, the first approver to respond makes the decision for the group.

Variable.name: policyViolations
Variable.Description: List of policy violations that were found during our initial policy scan. This list is passed into each work item so the approvers can see pending violations.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: String version of WorkItem.level that will be used to set the priority of any generated approval workitems.

Variable.name: approverElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by the batch approver when performing batch operations.

Workflow.Description:
The subprocess that drives the Create and Update Identity workflows. This is different then the Identity Request Approve subprocess because this approval process produces a form with the approval so that approvers can update values while approving.
This subprocess builds the form necessary for the editable approvals and then assimilates that data entered back to the plan, which can be returned from the subprocess.

Step.name: Customize Approval Form
Step.Description: using the form that was generaed, mMrk the password field read only so approvers can't change it. Also associate a Rule with the name so name changes during approvals can be validate.

Step.name: Build Approvers If Necessary
Step.Description: If the approvals weren't passed in then build them up using our default rule.

Step.name: Assimilate Form Changes
Step.Description: This step takes the form from the workitem and applys any edits that were made back into the plan.

Step.name: Check Plan and Update Cart
Step.Description: This step takes looks for name changes during creates and updates the stub identity on the plan accordingly.

Workflow.name: Approve and Provision Subprocess

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity being updated.

Variable.name: endOnManualWorkItems
Variable.Description: Option to skip requests with manual work items.

Variable.name: endOnProvisioningForms
Variable.Description: Option to skip requests with provisioning forms.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. Query for this using a projection query and fall back to the name.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: The provisioning plan ready to execute.

Variable.name: flow
Variable.Description:
The name of the LCM flow that launched this workflow.
This is one of these three values:
AccountsRequest EntitlementsRequest RolesRequest

Variable.name: optimisticProvisioning
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable optimistic provisioning. This will cause changes to the entitlements compiled from role assignments to be applied immediately to the identity cube rather than waiting for the next refresh/reaggregation after the provisioning system completes the request.

This prevents the browser session from hanging since provision can sometimes take a long time. For demos and testing it can be better to do this in the foreground so that provisioning will have been performed when control is returned to the user. This prevents having to run the Perform Maintenance task to see the results of the request.

Variable.name: batchRequestItemId
Variable.Description: Used by the batch interface to record back individual request item status. The specific item id for the individual request in the batch file.

Variable.name: userEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for user notification.

Variable.name: requesterEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for requester notification.

Variable.name: managerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for manager notification.

Variable.name: securityOfficerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for security officer notification.

Variable.name: approvalMode
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies how we should handle the approvals.
By default this is serial since most of these request with the exception of manager transfers will have only one approver.
parallel Approvals are processed concurrently and there must be consensus, we wait for all approvers to approve. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
parallelPoll Approvals are processed concurrently but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections.
serial Approvals are processed one at a time and there must be consensus. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
serialPoll Approvals are processed in order but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections. In effect we are "taking a poll" of the approvers.
any Approvals are processed concurrently, the first approver to respond makes the decision for the group.

Variable.name: approvalScheme
Variable.Description:
A csv string that specifies how approval items should be generated for the incoming request.
The value can be "none", in which case approvals are disabled.
The value can also be a combination of any of the values below in any order, separated by commas. The order in which they are specified is the order in which they are processed:
owner The object owner gets the approval item. For Role approvals this is the Role object owner. For Entitlement approvals this is the Entitlement object owner.
manager The manager gets the approval item.
securityOfficer The identity in the variable securityOfficerName gets the approval item.
identity The identities/workgroups in the variable approvingIdentities get the approval item.

Variable.name: approvalEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for approval notifications.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: The String version of a WorkItem.Priority. This variable is used to set the priority on all of the workitems generated as part of this workflow and also set on the IdentityRequest object.

Variable.name: securityOfficerName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity that will be sent approvals during security officer approvals.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: A String that specifies the name of the Identity that will be assigned any approvals where the owner of the approver can't be resolved. Example if the scheme is "owner" and the application doesn't specify and owner.

Variable.name: enableRetryRequest
Variable.Description: When set to true it will disable the workflow retry loop and let the Provision step launch requests to handle the retries. Enabling this flag will enable some older functionality.

Variable.name: source
Variable.Description: String version of sailpoint.object.Source to indicate where the request originated. Defaults to LCM.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this workflow and when set to true trace will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description:
This attributes is set during the "Build Approval Set" step, which builds this list by going through the ProvisioningPlan to build the line items that need to be approved,
This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: ProvisioningProject which is just a compiled version of the ProvisioningPlan.

Variable.name: policyViolations
Variable.Description: List of policy violations that were found during our initial policy scan. This list is passed into each work item so the approvers can see pending violations.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description: The sequence id of the Identity request object which is stored in the name field of the identity request and auto-incremented.

Variable.name: workItemComments
Variable.Description: Global comments accumulated during the workflow which should be shared with other approvals. When a new approval is created, the comments in this list will be added to the work item.

Variable.name: ticketManagementApplication
Variable.Description: Name of the application that can handle ticket requests. When non-null the Manage Ticket Steps will be visited to open tickets during the workflow lifecycle.

Variable.name: managerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by a manager.

Variable.name: ownerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by object owners.

Variable.name: securityOfficerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by the security officer.

Variable.name: filterRejects
Variable.Description: True to filter rejected items when running in Serial/SerialPoll mode.

Variable.name: setPreviousApprovalDecisions
Variable.Description: True to pre-populate approval decisions from previous approvals.

Variable.name: approvalSplitPoint
Variable.Description: Approval Scheme to split on.

Variable.name: clearApprovalDecisions
Variable.Description: True to clear any decisions on approvals built with buildCommonApprovals

Variable.name: approvingIdentities
Variable.Description: List of identities and/or workgroups names/ids that should be involved in the approval process.

Variable.name: ownerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the owner of pending approvals.

Variable.name: splitProvisioning
Variable.Description: True to tell IdentityRequest Provisioning subprocess that this is a subset of the initial provisioning plan

Workflow.Description: Subprocess to approve and provision immediately. This is used after splitting an ApprovalSet into individual items to run in parallel.

Step.name: Update Ticket Post Approval
Step.Description:
Call a subprocess to update the ticket in the ticketManagementApplication is non-null.
You can specify a specific 'ticketDataGenerationRule' here or you can also specify it on the application. It'll be read from the argument first and fall back to the ' application config.

Step.name: Provision
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess that will process the approval decisions and do provisioning. This includes calling any configured provisioning connectors and building manual actions.

Step.name: Update Ticket Post Provision
Step.Description:
Call a subprocess to update the ticket in the ticketManagementApplication is non-null.
You can specify a specific 'ticketDataGenerationRule' here or you can also specify it on the application. It'll be read from the argument first and fall back to the ' application config.

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity being updated.

Variable.name: endOnManualWorkItems
Variable.Description: Option to skip requests with manual work items.

Variable.name: endOnProvisioningForms
Variable.Description: Option to skip requests with provisioning forms.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. Query for this using a projection query and fall back to the name.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: The provisioning plan ready to execute.

Variable.name: flow
Variable.Description:
The name of the LCM flow that launched this workflow.
This is one of these three values:
AccountsRequest EntitlementsRequest RolesRequest

Variable.name: optimisticProvisioning
Variable.Description: Set to true to enable optimistic provisioning. This will cause changes to the entitlements compiled from role assignments to be applied immediately to the identity cube rather than waiting for the next refresh/reaggregation after the provisioning system completes the request.

Variable.name: foregroundProvisioning
Variable.Description: Normally provisioning is done in a step that uses the "background" option to force the workflow to be suspend and be resumed in a background task thread. This prevents the browser session from hanging since provision can sometimes take a long time. For demos and testing it can be better to do this in the foreground so that provisioning will have been performed when control is returned to the user. This prevents having to run the Perform Maintenance task to see the results of the request.

Variable.name: batchRequestItemId
Variable.Description: Used by the batch interface to record back individual request item status. The specific item id for the individual request in the batch file.

Variable.name: doRefresh
Variable.Description: Set to true to cause an identity refresh after the changes in the plan have been provisioned. This is normally off, you might want this on if you want modification of identity or link attributes to result in an immediate re-evaluation of assigned and detected roles.

Variable.name: notificationScheme
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies who should be notified when the request has been complete. The value can be null or a csv of one or more of the following options.
none or null disable notifications
user Identity that is being update will be notified.
manager The manager of the Identity that is being updated will be notified.
requester The person that has requested the update will be notified.

Variable.name: userEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for user notification.

Variable.name: requesterEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for requester notification.

Variable.name: managerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for manager notification.

Variable.name: securityOfficerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for security officer notification.

Variable.name: approvalMode
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies how we should handle the approvals.
By default this is serial since most of these request with the exception of manager transfers will have only one approver.
parallel Approvals are processed concurrently and there must be consensus, we wait for all approvers to approve. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
parallelPoll Approvals are processed concurrently but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections.
serial Approvals are processed one at a time and there must be consensus. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
serialPoll Approvals are processed in order but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections. In effect we are "taking a poll" of the approvers.
any Approvals are processed concurrently, the first approver to respond makes the decision for the group.

Variable.name: approvalScheme
Variable.Description:
A csv string that specifies how approval items should be generated for the incoming request.
The value can be "none", in which case approvals are disabled.
The value can also be a combination of any of the values below in any order, separated by commas. The order in which they are specified is the order in which they are processed:
owner The object owner gets the approval item. For Role approvals this is the Role object owner. For Entitlement approvals this is the Entitlement object owner.
manager The manager gets the approval item.
securityOfficer The identity in the variable securityOfficerName gets the approval item.
identity The identities/workgroups in the variable approvingIdentities get the approval item.

Variable.name: approvalEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for approval notifications.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: The String version of a WorkItem.Priority. This variable is used to set the priority on all of the workitems generated as part of this workflow and also set on the IdentityRequest object.

Variable.name: securityOfficerName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity that will be sent approvals during security officer approvals.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: A String that specifies the name of the Identity that will be assigned any approvals where the owner of the approver can't be resolved. Example if the scheme is "owner" and the application doesn't specify and owner.

Variable.name: policyScheme
Variable.Description:
A String that specifies how policy checks effect the overall process.
none - disabled policy checking
continue - continue if policy violations are found
interactive - allow requester to remove request items which are causing violations
fail - this option will cause the workflow to terminate immediately if any policy violations are found. Note that the requester will not be notified that the workflow has terminated.

Variable.name: enableRetryRequest
Variable.Description: When set to true it will disable the workflow retry loop and let the Provision step launch requests to handle the retries. Enabling this flag will enable some older functionality.

Variable.name: policiesToCheck
Variable.Description: A List of policies that should be checked. If this list is empty all violations will be checked. Used in combination with policyScheme.

Variable.name: source
Variable.Description: String version of sailpoint.object.Source to indicate where the request originated. Defaults to LCM.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this workflow and when set to true trace will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description:
This attributes is set during the "Build Approval Set" step, which builds this list by going through the ProvisioningPlan to build the line items that need to be approved,
This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: allowRequestsWithViolations
Variable.Description: If this variable is set to true, requesters will be able to proceed past the Policy Violation Review form without taking any action on policy violations resulting from the request. This is only relevant if policyScheme=interactive.

Variable.name: requireViolationReviewComments
Variable.Description: If true, requesters will be required to enter in comments if they proceed with a request that will result in policy violations. This is only relevant if policyScheme=interactive.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: ProvisioningProject which is just a compiled version of the ProvisioningPlan.

Variable.name: policyViolations
Variable.Description: List of policy violations that were found during our initial policy scan. This list is passed into each work item so the approvers can see pending violations.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description: The sequence id of the Identity request object which is stored in the name field of the identity request and auto-incremented.

Variable.name: violationReviewDecision
Variable.Description:
Decision made by the user in the Policy Violation Review step. This may be one of three choices:
-ignore: User is ignoring the violations and letting the request continue. If requireViolationReviewComments=true the user will be required to enter comments indicating why they are allowing the violations.
-remediate: Indicates that the user removed the request items that were causing the violations
-cancel: Indicates that the user decided to abandon the request, terminating the workflow.

Variable.name: workItemComments
Variable.Description: Global comments accumulated during the workflow which should be shared with other approvals. When a new approval is created, the comments in this list will be added to the work item.

Variable.name: ticketManagementApplication
Variable.Description: Name of the application that can handle ticket requests. When non-null the Manage Ticket Steps will be visited to open tickets during the workflow lifecycle.

Variable.name: ticketId
Variable.Description: The id of the ticket that is generated by the ticketingManagementApplication. This is typically generated on the "open" call, and then used in subsequent calls. It is also stored on the IdentityRequest object under the externalTicketId variable.

Variable.name: managerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by a manager.

Variable.name: ownerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by object owners.

Variable.name: securityOfficerElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by the security officer.

Variable.name: approvingIdentities
Variable.Description: List of identities and/or workgroups names/ids that should be involved in the approval process.

Variable.name: identityElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by identities and/or workgroups.

Variable.name: identityEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: Name of the email template to use when notifying the identities/workgroups of pending approvals.

Variable.name: filterRejects
Variable.Description: True to filter rejected items when running in Serial/SerialPoll mode.

Variable.name: setPreviousApprovalDecisions
Variable.Description: True to pre-populate approval decisions from previous approvals.

Variable.name: approvalSplitPoint
Variable.Description: Variable to determine when to split into parallel processing. This should map to a configured approvalScheme. We will process all schemes up until the approvalSplitPoint in the Pre Split approvals, and the remaining schemes after we split the items. If this is not specified, we will not split the Provisioning project, and process the entire project as a whole.

Variable.name: splitPlans
Variable.Description: List of ProvisioningPlan that is generated from the splitPlans step if approvalSplitPoint is set.

Variable.name: splitProjects
Variable.Description: Variable to store the returns if approvalSplitPoint is set. This will contain a List<ProvisioningProject>

Variable.name: splitApprovalSet
Variable.Description: Variable to store the list of approvalSets returned from the split subprocess if approvalSplitPoint is set.

Variable.name: splitWorkItemComments
Variable.Description: Variable to store the list of WorkItem comments returned from the split subprocess if approvalSplitPoint is set.

Step.name: Initialize
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess to initialize the request, this includes auditing, building the approvalset, compiling the plan into project and checking policy violations.

Step.name: Create Ticket
Step.Description: Call a subprocess to create a ticket in the ticketManagementApplication is non-null. You can specify a specific 'ticketDataGenerationRule' here or you can also specify it on the application. It'll be read from the argument first and fall back to the ' application config.

Step.name: Pre Split Approve
Step.Description: Call to our standard subprocess to handle the default approvals for manager, owner and security officer.

Step.name: Split Plan
Step.Description: Step to split the provisioning project into individual projects for each item requested. This will only run if the approvalSplitPoint is configured.

Step.name: Approve and Provision Split
Step.Description: Call the Approve and Provision Subprocess for each Provisioning Project generated in the Split Plan step.

Step.name: Assimilate Splits
Step.Description: Assimilate all projects returned from the split into the global project.

Step.name: Approve and Provision
Step.Description: Finish any remaining approvals and provision.

Step.name: Refresh Identity
Step.Description: Add arguments as necessary to enable refresh features. Typically you only want this to correlate roles. Don't ask for provisioning since that can result in provisioning policies that need to be presented and it's too late for that. This is only to get role detection and exception entitlements in the cube.

Step.name: Notify
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess that will notify the various actors based on notification scheme.

Arg.name: message
Arg.value: Failed due to manual work item(s)

Step.name: Finalize
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess that can audit/finalize the request.

Variable.Description:
A string that specifies how we should handle the approvals.
By default this is serial since most of these request with the exception of manager transfers will have only one approver.

Variable.name: approvalScheme
Variable.Description:
A String that specifies how approvals should be generated for this workflow there are three built-in modes
none - disabled approvals
manager - The user's current manager will get approvals
newManager - The newly assigned manager will get approvals when manager transfers occur. Otherwise the user's manager current manager will be the approver.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: A String that specifies the name of the Identity that will be assigned any approvals where the owner of the approver can't be resolved. Example if the scheme is "owner" and the application doesn't specify and owner.

Variable.name: approvalEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for approval notifications.

Variable.name: securityOfficerName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity that will be sent approvals during security officer approvals.

Variable.name: policyScheme
Variable.Description:
A String that specifies how policy checks effect the overall process.
none - disabled policy checking
fail - fail and exit the workflow if any policy violations are found
continue - continue if policy violations are found

Variable.name: ticketManagementApplication
Variable.Description: Name of the application that can handle ticket requests. When non-null the Manage Ticket Steps will be visited to open tickets during the workflow lifecycle.

Variable.name: ticketId
Variable.Description: The id of the ticket that is generated by the ticketingManagementApplication. This is typically generated on the "open" call, and then used in subsequent calls. It is also stored on the IdentityRequest object under the externalTicketId variable.

Variable.name: policiesToCheck
Variable.Description: A List of policies that should be checked. If this list is empty all violations will be checked. Used in combination with policyScheme.

Variable.name: policyViolations

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description:
This attributes is set during the "Build Approval Set" step, which builds this list by going through the ProvisioningPlan to build the line items that need to be approved,
This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this workflow and when set to true trace will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: ProvisioningProject which is just a compiled version of the ProvisioningPlan.

Variable.name: approvalForm
Variable.Description: The form that is generated based on the changes that were made. This form will be sent into the workitem and allow editing of the requested values during the approval process. This is generated in "Build Approval Form" based on the passed-in plan.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description: The sequence id of the Identity request object which is stored in the name field of the identity request.

Variable.name: approverElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by the batch approver when performing batch operations.

Step.name: Build Approval Set
Step.Description:
The rule will go through the plan and build an approvalItem for each AccountRequest, typically there is just one for the IIQ application requests.
The rule will also annotate the plan with the previousValues so that they can be assimilated onto the Form that is build, which is used during the approval process for edits.
Because this has some special handling keep it here in the workflow and pass the approval set into the initialization process.

Step.name: Initialize
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess to initialize the request, this includes auditing, building the approvalset, compiling the plan into a project and checking policy violations.

Step.name: Create Ticket
Step.Description: Call a subprocess to create a ticket in the ticketManagementApplication is non-null. You can specify a specific 'ticketDataGenerationRule' here or you can also specify it on the application. It'll be read from the argument first and fall back to the ' application config.

Step.name: Approve
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess that will handle the built-in owner, manager and security officer approval schemes.

Step.name: Update Ticket Post Approval
Step.Description:
Call a subprocess to update the ticket in the ticketManagementApplication is non-null.
You can specify a specific 'ticketDataGenerationRule' here or you can also specify it on the application. It'll be read from the argument first and fall back to the ' application config.

Step.name: Recompile Project
Step.Description:
Recompile the provisioning project with the plan. The plan may contain modifications from the original plan if it was modified during the approval process. If you need to pass in provisioner options like "noFiltering" or "noRoleDeprovisioning" you must pass them as explicit arguments to the call.
The evaluation options "requester" and "source" are commonly set here.
You can also pass things into the Template and Field scripts by defining Args in this step.

Step.name: Provision
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess that will process the approval decisions and do provisioning. This includes calling any configured provisioning connectors and building manual actions.

Step.name: Post Provision
Step.Description: Mark all of the items in the approvalset provisioned since these are all synchronous activities.

Step.name: Update Ticket Post Provision
Step.Description:
Call a subprocess to update the ticket in the ticketManagementApplication is non-null.
You can specify a specific 'ticketDataGenerationRule' here or you can also specify it on the application. It'll be read from the argument first and fall back to the ' application config.

Step.name: Refresh Identity
Step.Description: Add arguments as necessary to enable refresh features. Typically you only want this to correlate roles and possibly provision if we notice new assigned roles. Note that provisioning will be done in the Identity Refresh workflow so if there are any provisioning forms to display we won't feed them directly to the current user, they'll have to return to the inbox.

Step.name: Notify
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess that will notify the various actors based on notification scheme.

Arg.name: message
Arg.value: Failed due to manual work item(s)

Step.name: Finalize
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess that can audit/finalize the request.

A string that specifies who should be notified when the request has been complete. The value can be null or a csv of one or more of the following options.
none or null disable notifications
user Identity that is registering will be notified.

Variable.Description: The email template to use for manager notification.

Variable.name: securityOfficerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for security officer notification.

Variable.name: approvalMode
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies how we should handle the approvals.
By default this is serial since most of these request with the exception of manager transfers will have only one approver.
parallel Approvals are processed concurrently and there must be consensus, we wait for all approvers to approve. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
parallelPoll Approvals are processed concurrently but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections.
serial Approvals are processed one at a time and there must be consensus. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
serialPoll Approvals are processed in order but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections. In effect we are "taking a poll" of the approvers.
any Approvals are processed concurrently, the first approver to respond makes the decision for the group.

Variable.name: approvalScheme
Variable.Description:
A csv string that specifies how approvals should be generated for the incoming request.
The value can be any of the values below, combined together but are always processed in this order:
1. manager 2. securityOfficer
Any rejected items from previous approvals will be omitted from the next phase of approvers.
none - disabled approvals
manager - The manager will get all approvals
securityOfficer - The identity named in the variable securityOfficerName.

Variable.name: approvalEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for approval notifications.

Variable.name: securityOfficerName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity that will be sent approvals during security officer approvals.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: A String that specifies the name of the Identity that will be assigned any approvals where the owner of the approver can't be resolved. Example if the scheme is "owner" and the application doesn't specify and owner.

Variable.name: policyScheme
Variable.Description:
A String that specifies how policy checks effect the overall process.
none - disabled policy checking
fail - fail and exit the workflow if any policy violations are found
continue - continue if policy violations are found

Variable.name: ticketManagementApplication
Variable.Description: Name of the application that can handle ticket requests. When non-null the Manage Ticket Steps will be visited to open tickets during the workflow lifecycle.

Variable.name: policiesToCheck
Variable.Description: A List of policies that should be checked. If this list is empty all violations will be checked. Used in combination with policyScheme.

Variable.name: source
Variable.Description: String version of sailpoint.object.Source to indicate where the request originated. Defaults to LCM.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this workflow and when set to true trace will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: approverElectronicSignature
Variable.Description: The name of the electronic signature object that should be used when workitems are completed by the approver.

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity we're creating.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated.

Variable.name: confirmationForm
Variable.Description: A form that gets displayed for confirming the registration.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: The ProvisioningPlan that gets generated from the form input.

Variable.name: identityModel
Variable.Description: The identity model that is used to represent the identity being created.

Variable.name: ticketId
Variable.Description: The id of the ticket that is generated by the ticketingManagementApplication. This is typically generated on the "open" call, and then used in subsequent calls. It is also stored on the IdentityRequest object under the externalTicketId variable.

Variable.name: policyViolations
Variable.Description: List of policy violations that were found during our initial policy scan. This list is passed into each work item so the approvers can see pending violations.

Step.name: Initialize
Step.Description: Initialize the data for the identity that we are creating.

Step.name: Registration Form
Step.Description: Display the registration form to collect information about the registrant.

Step.name: Build Confirmation Form
Step.Description: Create the confirmation form to be displayed.

Step.name: Confirmation Form
Step.Description: Display the confirmation form to the registrant.

Step.name: Verify
Step.Description: This is a place-holder step where verification of the information could occur before a creation request is launched. This could potentially call out to an external system to verify some unique information (eg - employeeId) before continuing on.

Step.name: Set identity name
Step.Description: Set the identityName workflow variable based on the form input.

Script.Source: return identityModel.get("name");

Step.name: Build Provisioning Plan
Step.Description: Convert the registration request into a provisioning plan.

Step.name: Submit Registration Request
Step.Description: Call the LCM Create and Update workflow with the plan that was created.

Variable.name: identityName
Variable.Description: The name of the identity being updated.

Variable.name: identityDisplayName
Variable.Description: The displayName of the identity being updated. Query for this using a projection query and fall back to the name.

Variable.name: batchRequestItemId
Variable.Description: Used by the batch interface to record back individual request item status. The specific item id for the individual request in the batch file.

Variable.name: endOnManualWorkItems
Variable.Description: Option to skip requests with manual work items.

Variable.name: endOnProvisioningForms
Variable.Description: Option to skip requests with provisioning forms.

Variable.name: plan
Variable.Description: The provisioning plan ready to execute.

Variable.name: flow
Variable.Description:
The name of the flow that launched this workflow.
This is one of these three values:
ForgotPassword ExpiredPassword PasswordRequest

Variable.name: foregroundProvisioning
Variable.Description: Normally provisioning is done in a step that uses the "background" option to force the workflow to be suspend and be resumed in a background task thread. This prevents the browser session from hanging since provision can sometimes take a long time. For demos and testing it can be better to do this in the foreground so that provisioning will have been performed when control is returned to the user. This prevents having to run the Perform Maintenance task to see the results of the request.

Variable.name: notificationScheme
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies who should be notified when the request has been complete. The value can be null or a csv of one or more of the following options.
none or null disable notifications
user Identity that is being update will be notified.

Variable.name: source
Variable.Description: String version of sailpoint.object.Source to indicate where the request originated. Defaults to LCM.

Variable.name: ticketManagementApplication
Variable.Description: Name of the application that can handle ticket requests. When non-null the Manage Ticket Steps will be visited to open tickets during the workflow lifecycle.

Variable.name: userEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for user notification.

Variable.name: requesterEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for requester notification.

Variable.name: managerEmailTemplate
Variable.Description: The email template to use for manager notification.

Variable.name: ticketId
Variable.Description: The id of the ticket that is generated by the ticketingManagementApplication. This is typically generated on the "open" call, and then used in subsequent calls. It is also stored on the IdentityRequest object under the externalTicketId variable.

Variable.name: approvalSet
Variable.Description:
This attributes is set during the "Build Approval Set" step, which builds this list by going through the ProvisioningPlan to build the line items that need to be approved,
This variable includes all ApprovalItems that are part of the request process and is updated during the AfterScript of the approval process by assimilating the decisions and comments from the Approvals copy of the ApprovalItem.

Variable.name: trace
Variable.Description: Used for debugging this workflow and when set to true trace will be sent to stdout.

Variable.name: project
Variable.Description: ProvisioningProject which is just a compiled version of the ProvisioningPlan.

Variable.name: policyViolations
Variable.Description: List of policy violations that were found during our initial policy scan. This list is passed into each work item so the approvers can see pending violations.

Variable.name: identityRequestId
Variable.Description: The sequence id of the Identity request object which is stored in the name field of the identity request.

Variable.name: workItemPriority
Variable.Description: The String version of a WorkItem.Priority. This variable is used to set the priority on all of the workitems generated as part of this workflow and also set on the IdentityRequest object.

Variable.name: isProvisioningFailed
Variable.Description: This variable will keep track of provisioning errors reported in the Identity Request Items within the Identity Request object, so that we can prevent from notifying the user about provisioning actions status on failure.

Step.name: Initialize
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess to initialize the request, this includes auditing, building the approvalset, compiling the plan into a project and checking policy violations.

Step.name: Create Ticket
Step.Description: Call a subprocess to create a ticket in the ticketManagementApplication is non-null. You can specify a specific 'ticketDataGenerationRule' here or you can also specify it on the application. It'll be read from the argument first and fall back to the ' application config.

Step.name: Provision
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess that will process the approval decisions and do provisioning. This includes calling any configured provisioning connectors and building manual actions.

Step.name: Update Ticket Post Provision
Step.Description:
Call a subprocess to update the ticket in the ticketManagementApplication is non-null.
You can specify a specific 'ticketDataGenerationRule' here or you can also specify it on the application. It'll be read from the argument first and fall back to the ' application config.

Step.name: Notify
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess that will notify the various actors based on notification scheme.

Arg.name: message
Arg.value: Failed due to manual work item(s)

Step.name: Finalize
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess that can audit/finalize the request.

An example workflow that requires manager approval for all natively detected changes found by IdentityIQ.
Any items rejected by the manager will be reversed and provisioned.

Arg.name: workItemDescription
Arg.value: Native Account Changes for User: $(identityDisplayName) - Manager Approval

Step.name: Complete
Step.Description: Call the standard subprocess that can audit/finalize the request if they are in play.

Variable.name: approvalMode
Variable.Description:
A string that specifies how we should handle the approvals.
parallel Approvals are processed concurrently and there must be consensus, we wait for all approvers to approve. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
parallelPoll Approvals are processed concurrently but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections.
serial Approvals are processed one at a time and there must be consensus. The first approver that rejects terminates the entire approval.
serialPoll Approvals are processed in order but consensus is not required. All approvals will be processed, we don't stop if there are any rejections. In effect we are "taking a poll" of the approvers.
any Approvals are processed concurrently, the first approver to respond makes the decision for the group.

Variable.name: fallbackApprover
Variable.Description: A String that specifies the name of the Identity that will be assigned any approvals where the owner of the approver can't be resolved. Example if the scheme is "owner" and the application doesn't specify and owner.
